0.title: Greece minister leads humanitarian aid mission to Ukraine's Odessa
0.article_body: Greek Foreign Minister Nikos Dendias will land in Ukraine's Odessa on Sunday to lead a humanitarian aid mission in the city amid Russia's ongoing invasion of the country. Dendias will carry humanitarian aid which will be handed to the city's municipal authorities. The purpose of Dendias' visit is to also reopen Greece's consulate in the city, its foreign ministry said.

1.title: 68 undertrials in jails for petty crimes released after mega camp in Ludhiana
1.article_body: A mega camp court was organised by the District Legal Services Authority, Ludhiana on Saturday. During the camp, around 68 undertrials, who had been booked and jailed for petty offences, were released by officials. During the camp, the cases of undertrials in custody for petty offences, who were willing to confess to their crimes and plead guilty, were taken up.

2.title: 5 Bajrang Dal workers held for attacking K'taka halal meat seller
2.article_body: Five Bajrang Dal workers have been arrested in Karnataka's Shivamogga after they allegedly attacked a Muslim halal meat seller. This comes amid a campaign by Hindu right-wings to boycott halal products. The group, including the accused, had gone to the seller's shop on Wednesday and asked for non-halal meat. The group reportedly attacked after seller's relative asked them to leave.

3.title: PBKS skipper Mayank hasn't scored a lot so far in IPL 2022: Aakash
3.article_body: Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra, speaking about Punjab Kings captain Mayank Agarwal, opined that he has not scored many runs in the ongoing IPL 2022. "Mayank is the captain and is a solid player...He hasn't scored a lot so far, but you expect runs from him," Aakash stated. In IPL 2022, Mayank has scored 33 runs in two matches.

4.title: Punjab should first give Hindi-speaking areas to Haryana: Khattar
4.article_body: After the Punjab Assembly sought the transfer of Chandigarh to the state, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar asked the newly-formed AAP government to first hand over the Hindi-speaking areas to his state. "Rajiv-Longowal Accord was signed 35-36 years ago, as per which [Chandigarh] is the capital of both Haryana and Punjab," said Khattar.

5.title: 3-metre ring, other objects found in Maha after mysterious lights in sky, pics surface
5.article_body: A three-metre ring and other objects were found in Maharashtra after mysterious lights were spotted in sky on Saturday night. Experts speculate that the object seen falling from the sky is a satellite that got destroyed after coming into contact with the earth's atmosphere. Earlier, people speculated it could be a meteor shower. Police are working to ascertain the details.

6.title: Netflix halts development of Will Smith's film over Oscars slap: Report
6.article_body: Netflix has halted the production of Will Smith's action-thriller movie, 'Fast and Loose', following the Oscars incident with Chris Rock, according to The Hollywood Reporter. Smith had slapped the Oscars presenter and comedian Chris for making a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett's condition during the award ceremony. Smith later apologised to Chris Rock and resigned from the Oscars Academy.

7.title: Peace? I hate the word: World's richest person Elon Musk
7.article_body: The world's richest person, Elon Musk, on Sunday tweeted, "Peace. Peace? I hate the word. Those who do care about peace (myself aspirationally included) don't need to hear it...And those who don't care about peace? Well..." In an earlier tweet, he wrote, "They wrote PEACE on the wall at Berghain! I refused (to) enter." Berghain is a nightclub in Berlin.

8.title: Govt violated Constitution, will not leave Parliament: Pak Opposition on no-trust motion
8.article_body: Pakistan Peoples Party Chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari has said Pakistan government has violated Constitution by not allowing voting on no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan. He said, "The united opposition is not leaving Parliament. Our lawyers are on their way to Supreme Court." He added, "We call on all institutions to protect, uphold, defend and implement the Constitution of Pakistan."

9.title: There won't be any talks of terrorists in madrasas: UP Minister
9.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister Dharam Pal Singh said that the students will be given education in madrasas based on new National Education Policy. "Nationalism will be taught to students in madrasas of the state. There will be no talks of terrorists," he added. Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai's political secretary had earlier said madrasas propagate instigation to innocent kids.

10.title: Saudi minister meets SRK, Salman, Saif and Akshay Kumar in Mumbai, shares pics
10.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Minister of Culture Bader bin Farhan Alsaud met Bollywood actors Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan, Saif Ali Khan and Akshay Kumar during his Mumbai visit. "Delighted to have engaged in insightful conversations on the beautiful world of films, exploring cross-cultural collaborations [with them]," he wrote on Instagram, while sharing pictures.

11.title: Mizoram bans import of pigs, pork products amid African Swine Fever outbreak
11.article_body: The Mizoram government has banned the import of pigs and pork products until further orders after fresh African Swine Fever (ASF) cases were reported in the state, according to an official notification. The department has been directed to ensure safe disposal of pig carcasses. As many as 384 pig deaths were reported from across five districts of Mizoram, officials said.

12.title: Look at how Dhoni is batting, he's not finished, he's a finisher: Kaif
12.article_body: Ahead of CSK's match against PBKS, former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif praised CSK batter MS Dhoni for his performance in their first two games in IPL 2022. "Dhoni is not finished, he's a finisher. People have said his time is over...this could be his last IPL, but look at how he has batted, remaining not-out in both innings," stated Kaif.

13.title: Very impressed with Hardik Pandya's captaincy: Jaffer
13.article_body: Ex-India batter Wasim Jaffer has said he was "very impressed" with Hardik Pandya's captaincy as GT defeated DC by 14 runs to win their second game in a row. "By the end of the 15th over, Hardik had four overs of their specialist bowlers...Although he had to manage one over, I think...he trusted his main bowlers," stated Jaffer.

14.title: Pak Prez dissolves National Assembly on PM Imran Khan's advice
14.article_body: Pakistan President Arif Alvi on Sunday dissolved the country's National Assembly on the advice of Prime Minister Imran Khan to make way for fresh elections. "There should be elections in a democratic way. I call upon the people of Pakistan to prepare for elections," said Khan. Earlier, the Assembly Deputy Speaker rejected the no-confidence motion against Khan.

15.title: US Prez mistakenly refers to Michelle Obama as Vice President, video viral
15.article_body: US President Joe Biden in his recent speech mistakenly referred to former First Lady Michelle Obama as the former Vice President. Biden while praising First Lady Jill Biden said, "And I’m deeply proud of the work she is doing as First Lady with Joining Forces initiative she started with Michelle Obama when she was Vice President and now carries on."

16.title: It shall pass: Shilpa as Badshah says 'you've faced difficulties with a smile'
16.article_body: Rapper Badshah praised actress Shilpa Shetty and said she manages to remain strong despite all odds. While speaking to Shilpa on her fitness show, 'Shape of You', Badshah said, "After all that you've gone through, you manage to put up...a smile on your face and you don't fake it." Replying to this, Shilpa said, "Nothing is permanent...This too shall pass."

17.title: 3 held in Bihar for cheating Vaishno Devi pilgrims with fake chopper tickets
17.article_body: Three people were arrested from Bihar's Khagaria by the Jammu police for allegedly cheating people by providing fake tickets for helicopter rides from Katra to Mata Vaishno Devi shrine atop the hill nearby, police said on Saturday. Meanwhile, the Vaishno Devi Shrine Board said it has not authorised any private travel agency for helicopter bookings for Katra-Sanjichhat-Katra.

18.title: Arjun Rampal, Purab to star in investigative thriller series 'London Files'
18.article_body: Actors Arjun Rampal and Purab Kohli will be seen in an investigative thriller series, 'London Files'. The six-episode series has been directed by Sachin Pathak, the filmmaker behind shows like 'Kathmandu Connection' and 'A Simple Murder'. In addition to Arjun and Purab, 'London Files' will also feature Sapna Pabbi, Medha Rana, Gopal Datt and Eva Jane Willis in key roles.

19.title: Disapprove of policemen taking anyone's phone: B'luru police chief
19.article_body: Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Saturday shared a news report stating that police officers were "forcing" locals in the city to hand over their phones to check WhatsApp and photos, saying, "We strongly disapprove of any such act." He urged people to share the details of such incidents. "Strict action shall be taken against such officers," he added.

20.title: Anti-Romeo squads back in UP; to be active near schools, colleges
20.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has activated the anti-Romeo squads again in a bid to provide safety to women. According to Additional Chief Secretary Navneet Sehgal, the fortnight-long drive will continue till April 15. "Anti-Romeo squads will be activated near schools and colleges," said Sehgal. "In the evening, police will undertake patrolling in busy markets and crowded places," he added.

21.title: Imran Khan's ex-wife calls him 'mini-Trump', asks Twitter to take action on his tweet
21.article_body: Ahead of the no-trust motion against Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday, his ex-wife Reham Khan termed him "mini Trump" on Twitter and urged the platform to take action against him. She wrote, "This mini Trump must be restrained from inciting violence." Khan had called his political opponents as "the traitors who sold out to foreign masters" in a tweet.

22.title: Australia defeat England to win Women's World Cup for the 7th time
22.article_body: Australia defeated England by 71 runs in the final in Christchurch to win 2022 Women's World Cup. With this, Australia have now won seven Women's ODI World Cups. Australia put up a total of 356/5, the highest total in a Women's World Cup final. Australia's Alyssa Healy recorded the highest individual score (170 runs) in a Women's World Cup final.

23.title: Pakistan PM Imran Khan asks President to dissolve assemblies, hold fresh elections
23.article_body: After no-trust vote against Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan was rejected by the deputy speaker of the country's National Assembly, Imran said, "I have written to the President to dissolve the assemblies." He added, "There should be elections in a democratic way. I call upon the people of Pakistan to prepare for elections."

24.title: Mumbai’s annual food market, Ramzan Bazar, reopens after 2 years
24.article_body: After the state government lifted all the COVID-19 related curbs this month, Mumbai's annual food market, Ramzan Bazar, is set to reopen after remaining closed for two consecutive years. "This week, I met all the stakeholders, requested for strict hygiene...All the concerned departments will fully cooperate," said local MLA Amin Patel. Notably, Mohammed Ali Road is the market's traditional spot.

25.title: Additional OSCs to open in districts with high crime rate against women: Smriti Irani
25.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani said the Centre is planning to open additional one-stop centres (OSCs) in those districts where the crime rate against women is high. "We request your (states’) support to open these 300 new centres," Irani added. Additionally, government is planning to set up such centres in at least 10 other countries to support women of Indian origin.

26.title: 4 thieves cut open ATM in Gurugram, escape with cash worth ₹13.28 lakh
26.article_body: Four unidentified thieves allegedly cut open an ATM of a private bank in Gurugram and stole cash worth ₹13.28 lakh. Police said preliminary investigation revealed that the accused used a gas cutter to cut open the machine and sprayed the CCTVs with black paint before escaping. "The kiosk shutter was lowered and no security guard was deployed," an inspector said.

27.title: K'taka man throws mother in river, says 'Wife wanted to get rid of her'
27.article_body: A 38-year-old man allegedly killed his 60-year-old mother by throwing her into the Bhima river in Karnataka. The accused, Bheemashankar Yalimeli, during investigation, stated his wife wanted to get rid of his mother as she was ill. He also added he was facing difficulty in arranging money for his mother's treatment and he and his wife often fought over it.

28.title: In a first, SDMC collects over ₹1,000 crore in property tax
28.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation collected ₹1,075 crore from 460,000 taxpayers this year. According to Radha Krishan, head of the SDMC's property tax department, the corporation has crossed the ₹1,000 crore mark for the first time while it collected ₹943 crore in 2020-21. Krishan added that ₹917 crore was raised as property transfer duty which is also an all-time high.

29.title: Pakistan's Punjab Governor fired ahead of no-trust vote against PM
29.article_body: The Governor of Pakistan's Punjab province, Chaudhry Mohammad Sarwar, was fired on Sunday ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan in the National Assembly. According to media reports, Omar Sarfraz Cheema has been appointed as the new Governor of the province. Sarwar was not following the government line, added reports.

30.title: No-trust motion against Pakistan PM Imran Khan rejected
30.article_body: The no-confidence motion against Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan was rejected by Pakistan National Assembly Deputy Speaker Qasim Khan Suri on Sunday. Suri declared the motion as unconstitutional, reported ANI. Though PM Khan is the third premier to face the no-confidence motion, no one in Pakistan's history has ever been ousted through such a motion.

31.title: Pak Opposition moves motion to remove National Assembly Speaker
31.article_body: A Pakistan's Opposition member on Sunday moved a motion seeking the removal of the National Assembly Speaker Asad Qaiser ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan. Over 100 members of Opposition parties have reportedly signed the no-confidence motion against Qaiser. Notably, Section 144 has been imposed in Islamabad amid fears of violence.

32.title: 2 bodies found in Pune dam's backwaters after clothes seen nearby
32.article_body: The bodies of two men in their late 20s were fished out from the backwaters of Khadakwasla Dam, located on the outskirts of Pune, police said on Sunday. The incident came to light after locals informed guards about two pairs of shoes and clothes lying near the dam, while no human activity was seen inside the backwaters, an official said.

33.title: Nortje, Warner likely to play in DC's next game, says Ponting
33.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said it's likely that South Africa pacer Anrich Nortje and Australia batter David Warner will be available for their next game against LSG on April 7. "Nortje bowled 100% in the warm-ups...[and] I think Warner has arrived in Mumbai," stated Ponting. After winning their opening game against MI, DC lost to GT on Saturday.

34.title: I still need to gather courage to post a picture in a bikini: Mrunal
34.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur feels India hasn't normalised different body types. "We still think if you're going to a beach you've to have a perfect body," she added. "It's okay to be bloated...You...[don't] necessarily [need]...six-pack abs," she said. Mrunal said she still needs to gather the courage to post a picture in a bikini and be comfortable in her body type.

35.title: Actor Vikrant Massey gets Gulzar's juttis as birthday gift, shares pic
35.article_body: Actor Vikrant Massey took to Instagram Stories to share that he received lyricist Gulzar's juttis as a birthday gift. He shared a picture of the juttis and a letter from Gulzar's daughter Meghna, who he had worked with in Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Chhapaak'. "Dear Vikrant...This was long overdue...But I am glad I got it done today!" the letter by Meghna read.

36.title: Man who claimed he accidentally kissed woman in Mumbai train gets 1-yr jail term
36.article_body: A 37-year-old man was sentenced to one year of rigorous imprisonment and a fine of ₹10,000 was imposed on him for forcibly kissing a woman on her cheek in a local train in Mumbai in 2015. The man had claimed that he was pushed by fellow commuters, following which he fell on her and his lips accidentally touched her cheeks.

37.title: China sees highest COVID cases since Feb 2020, 1 detected with new subtype of Omicron
37.article_body: China has reported over 13,000 new COVID-19 cases, the highest since the peak of the first wave more than two years ago. State media reported a case infected with a new subtype of the Omicron variant. The new iteration of the virus, isolated from a mild COVID-19 patient, evolved from the BA.1.1 branch of the Omicron variant, Global Times reported.

38.title: On-duty police officer falls after bull hits him in Delhi, video surfaces
38.article_body: In a CCTV footage that has surfaced online, a bull can be seen pushing an on-duty police officer on a road in Delhi. The police officer, Gyaan Singh, can be seen falling to the ground after the animal pushes him. Reports said that after the incident, the constable was taken to the hospital and has now been discharged.

39.title: I get uncomfortable when somebody calls me an OTT star: Rohit Saraf
39.article_body: Rohit Saraf in an interview said, "It makes me uncomfortable when somebody calls me...OTT star." "Because I feel...you're putting me in a box that I'm not willing to be in," he added. "I don't want to label myself an...OTT actor or...film actor. If there's...a street play, and I think it's...something from which I can learn, I'll do it," Rohit said.

40.title: I can't hit such shots even if I start batting again: Aakash on Buttler's 100(68)
40.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has praised RR batter Jos Buttler for his 100 of 68 balls against MI, stating that it "gladdens the heart" to see the 31-year-old bat. "From a batter's point of view, I will not be able to hit such shots even if I start batting again," Aakash added. RR defeated MI by 23 runs in the match.

41.title: 15 Thane school students fall sick due to suspected food poisoning; 4 hospitalised
41.article_body: Around 15 students of an ashram school in Thane's Bhiwandi started vomiting and suffered from diarrhoea after consuming regular meals at the ashram, officials said. While 11 were discharged after primary treatment, four were admitted to the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Hospital in Kalwa. The ashram's general secretary claimed the students suffered from dehydration and not food poisoning.

42.title: You taught me so much: Abhishek shares old pic with Ajay on his b'day
42.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram on Saturday to wish Ajay Devgn on his birthday. He shared an old picture with Ajay from the set of the 1998 film 'Major Saab', and wrote, "Happy birthday AJ. A photo from...shoot of 'Major Saab'. My first job as a production boy. I knew nothing about a...set and you taught me so much."

43.title: Actress Estelle Harris, voice of Mrs Potato Head in Toy Story films, dies at 93
43.article_body: Veteran American actress Estelle Harris, who voiced the character of Mrs Potato Head in Pixar's 'Toy Story' franchise, has passed away at the age of 93. She died on Saturday at her residence in Palm Desert, California, of natural causes, her son Glen Harris told The Hollywood Reporter. Estelle was also known for her role in the sitcom 'Seinfeld'.

44.title: Ukraine would not have been invaded if I was in White House: Trump
44.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump claimed during a rally that Ukraine's invasion by Russian President Vladimir Putin would never have happened if he was in White House. He also said that when people say he knows Putin it's a "good thing, not a bad thing". Earlier, Trump had said, "The problem isn't that Putin is smart...but...that our leaders are dumb."

45.title: UP man dies as bullet accidentally hits face while fiddling with pistol
45.article_body: A 35-year-old jeweller, Rahul Verma, from Uttar Pradesh died after he accidentally fired from his own licensed pistol. His father said that he was fiddling with the pistol when it accidentally fired. Reports said that a bullet hit Rahul's face. Rahul was rushed to Ram Manohar Lohia hospital where he was declared brought dead.

46.title: Man saved from falling off dilapidated house during AAP roadshow in Guj
46.article_body: A group of men reportedly saved a man from falling off the roof of a multi-story structure in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. The incident took place during the road show of the Aam Aadmi Party. Reports said that the people who were accompanying AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann also asked people inside the building to evacuate it.

47.title: Security deployed, Section 144 imposed in Islamabad ahead of no-trust vote against Pak PM
47.article_body: The security has been tightened and Section 144 imposed in Pakistan's Islamabad ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan, which is set to take place in Parliament on Sunday. The administration has ordered a ban on pillion riders across the city. Earlier, Khan had urged people to take to the streets ahead of the motion.

48.title: BJP's poll wins give license to govt to loot people: Randeep Surjewala
48.article_body: Electoral victories for BJP have become a licence for the government to "loot" the people, Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said. "The diktat of the cruel, cumbersome and back-breaking price rise imposed by the PM Modi-led government with effect from April 1 has shattered the budget of every household in India," Surjewala added.

49.title: Marriage bureau penalised, told to refund fees for failing to find suitable match
49.article_body: The District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has penalised a marriage bureau in Chandigarh and directed it to refund the complainants' fee after it failed to find a suitable match. The commission observed that the company had exhibited a "negligent and careless attitude". The men whose profiles were shared were "overaged, bald, fat or weren't of desired caste", the commission added.

50.title: Won't condone social media block, useless due to VPN: Sri Lanka min
50.article_body: Sri Lankan Youth and Sports Minister Namal Rajapaksa on Sunday tweeted that he'll never condone the blocking of social media platforms in the country. This comes after the country blocked social media platforms over reports of protests being planned amid an economic crisis. "The availability of VPN, just like I'm using now, makes such bans completely useless," he said.

51.title: Karauli incident could’ve been avoided if administration was vigilant: Ex-Raj CM
51.article_body: Former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje condemned the stone-pelting incident in Karauli and said it could have been avoided if the administration was vigilant. Communal clashes broke out in Karauli on Saturday, injuring nearly 25 persons. "Hate mentality cannot be allowed to flourish in peace-loving Rajasthan. The administration should take strict action against the culprits," Raje added.

52.title: Algerian man held at Guantanamo Bay for 20 years by US released
52.article_body: The US has released an Algerian man, Sufiyan Barhoumi, imprisoned at the Guantanamo Bay detention centre for about 20 years. Barhoumi, who was captured in Pakistan and sent to Guantanamo in 2002, has been repatriated to his home country, said the Department of Defense. The release comes after the authorities determined he was not a member of Al-Qaeda or Taliban.

53.title: Was contacted by AAP but won't leave Congress: TS Singh Deo
53.article_body: Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has claimed that he was "contacted" by AAP but asserted that he "won't leave" Congress. "Five generations of my family have been in Congress... (Can't) think beyond Congress," Deo said. "I've not met Arvind Kejriwal but it's true... there are people who contact each other. So, it's not like nobody contacted me," he added.

54.title: Man killed by in-laws for getting married third time in Jharkhand
54.article_body: A 35-year-old man was killed allegedly by his in-laws for getting married for the third time in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district. According to the police, the skeleton of the deceased, Ladu Haiburu, was inside a well located in a Naxalism-hit area. Haiburu had a fight with his brother-in-law from an earlier marriage and went missing on March 16, police said.

55.title: Ex-Pak PM Nawaz Sharif attacked in London, daughter calls for Imran Khan's arrest
55.article_body: Former Pakistani PM Nawaz Sharif was allegedly attacked in London by an activist of PM Imran Khan's PTI party. This comes after Khan said if Sharif's brother, Shehbaz Sharif, takes over then they will do slavery of America. Sharif's daughter, Maryam Nawaz Sharif, called for the arrest of PM Khan, saying he should be booked for "provocation, incitement and sedition".

56.title: Suhana, Khushi to shoot for 40 days in Ooty for Zoya's The Archies: Report
56.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan, Boney Kapoor's daughter Khushi Kapoor and Amitabh Bachchan's grandson Agastya Nanda will reportedly shoot for Zoya Akhtar's upcoming project 'The Archies' in Ooty for the next 40 days with a local crew. Earlier, Suhana, Khushi and Agastya's photos from sets of the Archies adaptation had also gone viral on social media.

57.title: Woman was moved by 'The Kashmir...', wanted to feed us with her hands: Producer
57.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' producer Abhishek Agarwal said that while shooting the film, a local woman would bring food for the team. "It was not just for a couple of us, but it was for the entire crew. She was so moved that we were making this film, she wanted to feed us with her hands to express that," he said.

58.title: US agency confirms damage to 112 million years old dinosaur tracks
58.article_body: US' Bureau of Land Management has confirmed minor damages to the dinosaur tracks at Utah's Mill Canyon, which is about 112 million years old, due to machinery used for construction work there. This comes after a palaeontological assessment of the tracks. The agency said that it will follow the assessment's recommendations, seek public input and work with the palaeontology community.

59.title: I would love to but I think he's very busy: John on reuniting with Akshay
59.article_body: John Abraham has said he'd love to work with Akshay Kumar again. "I love Akshay...when we talk about two heroes...who...look good on screen together, it's Akshay and me," John said, adding, "But I think he's very busy...he's doing probably 144 films now? But I'm going to...work with him soon." They've worked together in films like 'Garam Masala' and 'Desi Boyz'.

60.title: 14 killed in floods, mudslides due to heavy rainfall in Brazil
60.article_body: At least 14 people were killed after heavy rainfall triggered floods and mudslides in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro state, said authorities. Cars were reportedly swept off as the streets in the coastal towns and cities were flooded. The authorities said that emergency rescue teams moved around 144 people to safety in the affected areas.

61.title: Enjoying my time with GT, two wins in two games, so far so good: Rashid Khan
61.article_body: GT spinner Rashid Khan has said he's enjoying his time with the franchise and trying to contribute as much as possible. On his bowling against DC, Rashid said, "[In] first over, I tried different grips to see which one is the right one on this wicket." So far, Rashid has picked a wicket each in their two games.

62.title: 50 tonnes of wood gutted as fire breaks out at godown in Gujarat, none injured
62.article_body: Over 50 tonnes of firewood were gutted after a fire broke out at a godown in a four-storey building in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. "Prima facie, it appears that welding work was going on in the building when the fire started due to the presence of thinner liquid," a fire official said. It took firefighters over five hours to douse the fire.

63.title: Couple spotted kissing in stands during DC-GT IPL 2022 match, pic goes viral
63.article_body: A couple was spotted kissing in the stands during IPL 2022 match between DC and GT. Reacting to the viral picture, a fan tweeted, "This couple took the IPL match to next level." "Kiss cam in IPL?" another fan wrote. Other tweets read, "IPL is truly going global" and "*Me starts watching IPL with my family*....That one couple: [kisses]."

64.title: Australia record the highest total in a final in Women's World Cup history
64.article_body: Australia put up a total of 356/5 against England in the 2022 Women's World Cup final, breaking the record for the highest total in a final in Women's World Cup history. The previous highest total in a Women's World Cup final was 259/7, registered by Australia in the 2013 edition against West Indies.

65.title: 9 NHAI officials among 22 booked by CBI for corruption in highway projects
65.article_body: Nine officials of NHAI and five companies are among 22 accused booked by the CBI for alleged corruption in the execution and operation of three highway projects. The NHAI officials, including three general manager-level officers, took a monthly bribe to the tune of ₹1-2 lakh from the accused companies, the CBI alleged. The offence took place between 2008 and 2010.

66.title: AAP creates atmosphere via media, nothing on ground: Anurag Thakur
66.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has alleged that AAP creates "an atmosphere via media" but has "nothing on the ground". "He (Arvind Kejriwal) couldn't win a seat in UP, did you see his condition in Uttarakhand, Goa?" Thakur asked the press in Chandigarh. He further said that BJP gets votes "unilaterally" in PM Narendra Modi's name wherever there are elections.

67.title: Ex-Odisha MLA Anup Sai sentenced to life for killing live-in partner, her daughter
67.article_body: Former Odisha MLA and Biju Janata Dal leader Anup Sai has been sentenced to life imprisonment by a Chhattisgarh court on charges of murdering his live-in partner and her daughter in 2016. Police claimed Sai conspired to kill her when she insisted on marriage and demanded a share in his property. Sai's driver, another accused in the case, was acquitted.

68.title: I may not accept result of no-confidence vote: Pakistan PM Imran Khan
68.article_body: Ahead of the vote on the no-confidence motion against him on Sunday, Pakistan PM Imran Khan said he had "more than one plan" in place and may not accept the move to oust him. Khan urged the country's youth to stage "peaceful protests" against a "foreign conspiracy" allegedly hatched against his government, while asking them not to criticise the Army.

69.title: Dad convinced his doctor that he needed 2 drinks at night to sleep: Ranbir
69.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor revealed his father, late actor Rishi Kapoor had the habit of having two drinks every night. Ranbir added that during the early stages of his cancer treatment in the US, he was worried about this routine being disrupted. "He tricked his doctor claiming...he wasn't able to sleep at night and as...remedy, he'd chug down two drinks," Ranbir said.

70.title: Can't deny adoption rights just because man is Muslim: Delhi court
70.article_body: A court in Delhi has granted custody parole to a Muslim prisoner so as to allow him to go sign adoption papers in Haryana. The court observed that the man can't be denied adoption rights just because he's a Muslim. The prosecution had opposed the parole claiming that Muslims can't adopt a child as it's not legally permissible in Islam.

71.title: It's my personal life and I don't like to discuss it: Taapsee on marriage plans
71.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, when asked about marriage plans, said she does not like to discuss her personal life. She also joked about wearing three rings. "In that case, I should be engaged to three people," Taapsee added. She further said she eats in accordance with weather. "Wherever I go...I tell the hotel staff...about my meals...they serve me accordingly," she added.

72.title: Malaika Arora to be discharged from hospital today after car accident
72.article_body: Malaika Arora, who was admitted to Apollo Hospital in Navi Mumbai after receiving some minor injuries in a car accident on Saturday, will be discharged from the hospital today. "Malaika has minor injuries on forehead, CT scan has turned out fine and she's currently okay," the hospital said on Saturday. The accident took place when Malaika was returning from Pune.

73.title: PNB branch in Ghaziabad robbed at gunpoint; 4 flee with ₹11 lakh
73.article_body: A Punjab National Bank branch in Ghaziabad was robbed at gunpoint by four men on Saturday, said police. The perpetrators, dressed in black and wearing red masks, fled with ₹11 lakh cash. "They held the staff inside the bank (at gunpoint) and fled with the money. We are ascertaining more information through CCTV footage to identify the accused," said police.

74.title: Drug addict kills sister after argument over domestic issues in Delhi
74.article_body: A drug addict murdered his 24-year-old sister in Delhi. He killed his sister after an argument over domestic issues reportedly broke out between them. Reports said that strangulation marks were found on the victim's neck. The accused confessed to killing his sister during investigation by the police. He also said that both of them were drug addicts.

75.title: Jadeja is under pressure, CSK openers need to perform: Shastri
75.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja is under pressure after suffering consecutive defeats in their two games in the ongoing IPL season. "There's a new captain at the helm, and he's under pressure. Yes, Dhoni is in form but if one of those openers doesn't score then CSK will find it difficult," stated Shastri.

76.title: Domino’s offers free assured surprise gifts worth ₹50 crore
76.article_body: Domino's has announced that it is throwing a birthday party where it's offering surprise gifts with every order. Gifts worth ₹50 crore will be given to customers, it revealed. The free assured surprise gifts can be availed by customers on delivery, dine-in, and takeaway orders via the Domino's app or at their stores.

77.title: Growing trust in India is helping in key deals: Piyush Goyal
77.article_body: PM Narendra Modi's decisions have been able to generate a lot of goodwill for India globally, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said. His statement comes as India and Australia signed the Economic Cooperation and Trade Agreement to boost economic ties. On being asked what is facilitating these trade deals, Goyal said, "Growing trust in India is helping in all such developments."

78.title: Pravin Tambe breaks down after watching his biopic with KKR team, video surfaces
78.article_body: Leg-spinner Pravin Tambe, who made his IPL debut aged 41, broke down after he watched the biopic on his life along with the KKR team. The movie 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?' was released on Friday and stars Shreyas Talpade. KKR shared a video on Twitter showing Tambe breaking down. "Just never give up on your dreams...Dreams do come true," he said.

79.title: India reports 1,096 new COVID-19 cases, 81 deaths in last 24 hours
79.article_body: India has reported 1,096 new COVID-19 cases and 81 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 1,260 cases and 83 deaths. Out of the 81 deaths reported today, 16 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 65 were reconciled deaths in Kerala.

80.title: Australia's Alyssa Healy records highest-ever score in a World Cup final
80.article_body: Australia opener Alyssa Healy has recorded the highest-ever score in a World Cup final across men's and women's cricket. The 32-year-old scored 170(138) against England in the 2022 Women's World Cup final today. She broke the previous record set by former Australian men's wicketkeeper-batter Adam Gilchrist, who had scored 149(104) against Sri Lanka in the 2007 World Cup final.

81.title: Remove mosque loudspeakers or will play Hanuman Chalisa there: Raj
81.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Saturday demanded that the Maharashtra government should remove loudspeakers at mosques and said that if this isn't done then loudspeakers will be placed outside mosques and "Hanuman Chalisa will be played at higher volume". "I'm not against prayers, you can pray at...home," he added. Moreover, he demanded that MP and MLA pensions should be stopped.

82.title: Drug trafficker sentenced to 14 yrs in prison by Bahraich court
82.article_body: A Nepal-based drug trafficker, who was arrested by NCB nearly five years ago, was sentenced to 14 years of rigorous imprisonment by a local court in Bahraich, NCB officials said. The court has imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on him and in case of non-payment of the fine, he will have to remain in prison for two more years.

83.title: Ghaziabad reverses order banning meat sale during Navratri
83.article_body: A day after imposing a ban on sale of raw meat during Navratri from April 2 to 10, the Ghaziabad Nagar Nigam reversed the order. In a fresh notification issued on Saturday, the mayor said the regulations by the state government would be followed. The officials said that no such ban has been ordered by the UP government so far.

84.title: Wearing mask is always safer: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray
84.article_body: On the first day of the removal of COVID-19 restrictions in Maharashtra, state Tourism and Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday urged people to follow the mask advisory. "Wearing a mask is always safer, don’t feel awkward wearing one for your own safety," Aaditya said. Recently, the Maharashtra government announced that wearing masks is no longer compulsory in the state.

85.title: Chandigarh allows restaurants, bars and hotels to stay open till 3 am
85.article_body: Under Chandigarh's new excise policy, restaurants, bars and hotels in the Union Territory can remain open till 3 am. "The facility of two-hour extension in closure timings [will be] given to restaurants, bars and hotels on payment of additional license fees," an official release stated. Low-alcoholic drinks, including beer and wine, have been exempted from license fees and taxes.

86.title: How can he die suddenly?: Maharashtra minister on Aryan Khan drug case witness
86.article_body: The death of Prabhakar Sail, an independent witness in the drugs-on-cruise case involving Aryan Khan, will be investigated by Maharashtra Police, said the state Home Minister, Dilip Walse Patil. He said people were wondering how "such a strong man could die of a heart attack so suddenly". The minister asked the Director General of Police to investigate Sail's death.

87.title: Broadway's Macbeth performances cancelled after Craig tests COVID +ve
87.article_body: Two performances of Macbeth on Broadway have been cancelled after Daniel Craig tested positive for COVID-19, a statement on the production's official Twitter account read. "We apologise for the inconvenience this causes ticket holders, but the safety of our audiences, the cast and crew remains our top priority," it added. The 54-year-old actor stars in the play opposite Ruth Negga.

88.title: Suspecting wife's extramarital affair, Hyd man kills minor daughter, self
88.article_body: A 40-year-old man died by suicide after killing his six-year-old daughter in Hyderabad. Reports said that the man suspected his wife of having an extramarital affair. The man had checked into a lodge with his daughter where he killed her and later died by suicide. His wife had expressed desire to move to Canada for her career after leaving job.

89.title: Did 'chhichhora' roles before Beta; cried when I was offered the film: Aruna
89.article_body: Actress Aruna Irani, who played Anil Kapoor's on-screen mother, Lakshmi Devi, in 'Beta' recalled that it was difficult for her to bag the role in the film even though it was helmed by her brother, Indra Kumar. Aruna added that she cried a lot after she bagged the role. "Before 'Beta', I used to do only chhichhora roles," she said.

90.title: GT's total was not so big, we could've batted better: Pant after defeat
90.article_body: After their 14-run defeat, DC captain Rishabh Pant said GT's 171-run total was not "so big" and they could've batted batter in the game. "[During] the powerplay, we lost three wickets, then in the middle overs we lost three wickets...every match is going to be hard to come back after losing so many wickets," he stated. Pant scored 43(29).

91.title: 16-yr-old booked for filming home tutor in bathroom in Pune
91.article_body: A 16-year-old boy in Pune has been booked for recording videos of his English home tutor while she was in the bathroom. The boy was arrested and sent to the District Women and Child Welfare Committee for counselling. "He had developed isolation symptoms during the lockdown period which had a significant impact on his mental state," said police.

92.title: Man, 5-yr-old son accidentally locked up at bank in Punjab; rescued
92.article_body: A man and his five-year-old son who had gotten accidentally locked up at a bank in Punjab's Ludhiana on Saturday were rescued after about two and a half hours. The father-son duo had come to the bank to deposit some cash. The man claimed he'd called out to the officials when they were pulling down the shutter, but was "ignored".

93.title: 20-yr-old youth arrested for killing his mother's 47-yr-old lover in Mumbai
93.article_body: A 20-year-old youth has been arrested in Mumbai for allegedly killing his mother's 47-year-old lover, police said. The incident took place when the accused reached home and found the victim and his mother together. Police added that an argument took place between them and in a fit of rage the youth took a kitchen knife and stabbed the victim.

94.title: DC were ahead till Rishabh was there, but Lockie changed the game: Hardik
94.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya praised pacer Lockie Ferguson for "changing the things" in their game against DC, which they won by 14 runs. Chasing 172 to win, DC were 118/4 in when Lockie dismissed Rishabh Pant and Axar Patel in the 15th over. "Till Rishabh was there...DC were ahead [but] that over really turned it for us," stated Hardik.

95.title: I had no one to talk to, I was depressed for a month: Rohit on World Cup 2011 snub
95.article_body: Talking about not being picked for World Cup 2011 in an interaction with Jemimah Rodrigues, India captain Rohit Sharma said he got the news when he was playing a series in South Africa. "I had no one to talk to at that point. I was just sitting in my room," he stated. Rohit added he was depressed for a month.

96.title: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 11th time in 13 days
96.article_body: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 11th time in 13 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹103.41/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹94.67/litre from ₹93.87/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹118.41/litre from ₹117.57/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹102.64/litre from ₹101.79/litre.

97.title: Sri Lanka blocks social media platforms after citizens plan protests against govt
97.article_body: Sri Lanka has blocked social media platforms after reports emerged that citizens were planning to launch protests over economic crisis all over the island despite the curfew. Facebook, Facebook Messenger, Twitter, WhatsApp, YouTube, Snapchat, Twitter Periscope, Google Video, TikTok, Viber, Telegram and Instagram have not been working, reports claimed. Sri Lanka has declared a public emergency.

98.title: My walk is like a duck; had to work hard to bring swag in 'Gangubai...': Alia
98.article_body: Alia Bhatt said her walk in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has a lot of "swag" and she had to work hard for it. "When I watch my own paparazzi videos, I feel like I walk strangely, like a duck. I had to make it more interesting," she added. Alia said she was inspired by Allu Arjun's swag in 'Pushpa' for 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'.

99.title: Bengaluru boy makes hoax bomb call to rly police over PUBG partner
99.article_body: A 12-year-old boy allegedly made a hoax bomb threat call to Railway police helpline to stop his classmate from boarding a train as he'd lose his PUBG partner and would have to stop playing. The boy had called around 2 pm on March 30 claiming that there was a bomb at Yelahanka railway station, causing its closure for 90 minutes.

100.title: PMC starts collecting ₹50 daily from illegal hawkers on roads
100.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has started collecting ₹50 daily from roadside hawkers doing business illegally from April 1. The money will be used for the purpose of garbage collection and administrative work. "These illegal hawkers use the public space and often surround it with garbage which is later supposed to be cleaned up by the PMC," said an official.

101.title: Mysterious lights spotted in sky in Maharashtra, MP, Gujarat; pics go viral
101.article_body: People in Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh and Gujarat witnessed mysterious trail of lights in the sky on Saturday. Astronomer Jonathan McDowell referred to the event seen over the states as a possible "re-entry of a Chinese rocket stage" that was launched in February 2021. Several experts also speculated that event could be a "meteor shower".

102.title: 42-year-old man killed, his body hanged from iron pipe in Pune
102.article_body: An unidentified person has been booked after a 42-year-old man was allegedly killed and then his body was hanged from an iron pipe to pass it off as suicide in Pune. A post-mortem report revealed that the deceased, whose body was found on Friday, died due to strangulation and head injury. An investigation is on to identify the accused.

103.title: Delhi policeman out with family attacked with knife for scolding man for rash driving
103.article_body: A Delhi Police sub-inspector who was out with his wife and two-year-old daughter was attacked with a knife after he confronted and scolded a man for driving rashly in a local market in Delhi. The policeman had asked the man to drive properly, following which the driver misbehaved with him, an officer said. An FIR was registered in this connection.

104.title: Hyd man demands action against man smoking near temple, police respond
104.article_body: A Twitter user asked Hyderabad Police on Saturday to take action against another man who allegedly refused to stop smoking near a temple when he was asked to do so. "He simply replied...'I'm not afraid of anyone'...Can we have any anti squad team for taking...action against...such things," the user wrote. Hyderabad Police asked him to share location of the incident.

105.title: Tesla delivers record 3,10,048 cars in Q1 as Musk calls it 'difficult quarter'
105.article_body: Tesla reported that it delivered record number of electric vehicles in the first quarter of 2022, despite ongoing supply chain challenges and factory shutdowns. Tesla said it delivered 3,10,048 vehicles during the first three months of this year. "This was an exceptionally difficult quarter due to supply chain interruptions & China's Zero COVID policy," Tesla's billionaire CEO Elon Musk said.

106.title: People may have lost their mind: Binance's billionaire CEO on NFT craze
106.article_body: Crypto exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao, speaking about the NFT craze, said, "People may have lost their mind." Referring to the NFT artwork which sold for $69.3 million last year, Zhao asked, "Nothing is worth that much, right?" The billionaire added that NFTs (non-fungible tokens) allow artists to monetise their work globally again and reach a much wider audience.

107.title: GT defeat DC to record 2nd win in a row, Shubman smashes his highest T20 score
107.article_body: GT defeated DC by 14 runs to register their second win a row in IPL 2022. The match witnessed GT opener Shubman Gill smash his highest score in T20s. Shubman scored 84 runs off 46 deliveries to help GT put up a total of 171/6. GT fast bowler Lockie Ferguson took four wickets as DC managed 157/9 in 20 overs.

108.title: 50 cattle being illegally transported recovered by Assam Police
108.article_body: The Assam Police on Friday recovered 50 cattle that were allegedly being illegally transported in two vehicles and arrested one person in connection with the incident. The cattle were being taken from Upper Assam to Nagaon. Sharing pictures of the cattle on Twitter, police wrote, "Two cattle vehicles were apprehended by Nagaon Police at Jajori PS and Borghat PP."

109.title: PM Modi extends greetings on commencement of Ramzan
109.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday conveyed his greetings on the commencement of Ramzan. "May this holy month inspire people to serve the poor. May it also further enhance the spirit of peace, harmony and compassion in our society," he said. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi also tweeted, "Ramzan Mubarak! May this pious month bring good health, peace and prosperity to all."

110.title: 2 arrested in HP's Shimla for consuming heroin near hospital gate
110.article_body: Two people, allegedly consuming heroin outside the Indira Gandhi Medical College and Hospital's (IGMC) gate in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla, were arrested by the police's Special Investigation Unit on Saturday. Police said that around 4.02 grams of the drug were also recovered from their possession. A case has been registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, police added.

111.title: Pakistan win an ODI series against Australia in 20 years
111.article_body: Pakistan beat Australia by nine wickets in third and final ODI in Lahore to clinch the three-match series 2-1. Haris Rauf's 3/39 and Mohammad Wasim's 3/40 helped Pakistan restrict Australia at 210, while an unbeaten 190-run second-wicket stand between skipper Babar Azam (105*) and Imam-ul-Haq's (89*) helped hosts win. It's Pakistan's first ODI series win against Australia in 20 years.

112.title: Sachin paaji said 'Build a partnership' as I walked in after his wicket: Kohli on WC final
112.article_body: Recalling 2011 World Cup final, which India won by defeating Sri Lanka on April 2, 2011, Virat Kohli said, "I remember the pressure of walking in to bat at two down...Sachin Tendulkar and Virender Sehwag...both were out." He added, "When I walked in...Sachin paaji said, 'Build a partnership'. We did build a partnership, me and Gautam Gambhir."

113.title: Move to the streets in interest of nation: Pak PM a day ahead of no-trust vote
113.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Saturday told people to take to the streets, a day ahead of the scheduled vote on the no-confidence motion tabled against him in the National Assembly. "You should do so (protest on the streets) for your conscience, in the interest of this nation," said Khan, during a Q&A session with the Pakistani public.

114.title: Retreating Russian troops planting mines in northern Ukraine: Prez
114.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday accused Russian forces of deliberately mining areas in northern Ukraine during their retreat from the region. "They are mining all this territory. Houses are mined, equipment is mined, even the bodies of dead people," he said. The retreat comes after Russia announced this week it would scale down military operations around Kyiv and Chernihiv.

115.title: 1st Kayaking & Canoeing marathon held on river Jhelum in J&K's Srinagar
115.article_body: The first-ever Kayaking and Canoeing marathon was held in J&K's Srinagar on Saturday. The marathon started from the Zero Bridge to Habba Kadal bridge on the Jhelum river. This event was organised as a part of 'My Youth, My Pride', J&K Sports Council Secretary, Nuzhat Gul, said, adding, "I urge...society to join hands and help keep...youths away from drugs."

116.title: Power regulator caps prices at ₹12/unit at exchanges amid rising demand
116.article_body:
The Central Electricity Regulatory Commission has asked the electricity exchanges to cap prices at 
₹12 per unit amid a surge in power demand. The power regulator said prices at power exchanges have remained "significantly" higher during the last few days. "Abnormally high price...is not only against consumer interest but also erodes the buyer's confidence in the market's credibility," it added.

117.title: Pakistan's Babar Azam creates history, becomes fastest batter to reach 16 ODI hundreds
117.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has created history by becoming the fastest batter to reach 16 hundreds in ODI cricket, achieving the feat during the third ODI against Australia in Lahore. The 27-year-old batter reached the milestone in his 84th ODI innings. The previous record was held by ex-South Africa batter Hashim Amla, who reached 16 hundreds in 94 ODI innings.

118.title: We tried everything but couldn't get him out: Rohit on Buttler's ton
118.article_body: Referring to Jos Buttler's 68-ball 100 against MI in IPL 2022, five-time champions MI's skipper Rohit Sharma said the RR opener played an "exceptional" innings. "We tried everything but we could not get him out. But, he played really well," he added. Notably, it's the first century of this season's IPL. MI have two losses from two matches so far.

119.title: German man gets 87 COVID-19 vaccine shots, held for selling vaccine passports
119.article_body: A 61-year-old German man has been arrested after he received at least 87 doses of the COVID-19 vaccine. As per a report, the man was paid by people who were against vaccination and he would get the vaccine so as to sell vaccination passports to such people. He reportedly received vaccine doses up to three times daily at different centres.

120.title: A 'powerful country' backing India is angry with Pakistan: Imran Khan
120.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has said that a "powerful country" which is backing India is angry with Pakistan because of his recent visit to Russia to meet President Vladimir Putin. His remarks came after his government summoned the US Charge d'Affaires in Islamabad to lodge a protest over US' alleged attempt to interfere with the country's internal affairs.

121.title: Illegal gun factory busted in Jharkhand's Dumka, 6 arrested
121.article_body: A joint team of Jharkhand Police and Kolkata Police raided an illegal gun factory in Jharkhand’s Dumka district on Saturday and seized a large number of unfinished pistols and revolvers. Six people from Bihar and Jharkhand, including a woman, were arrested, police said adding that the raid was conducted based on inputs provided by a person arrested by Kolkata Police.

122.title: Sec 144 imposed as 25 hurt in communal clashes in Rajasthan's Karauli
122.article_body: After communal clashes broke out in Rajasthan's Karauli injuring nearly 25 persons, Section 144 was imposed from 6:30 pm on Saturday till midnight on April 4. DM Rajendra Singh Shekhawat said internet services will remain suspended till midnight tomorrow. Reportedly, stones were pelted when a bike rally passed through a Muslim-dominated area. CM Ashok Gehlot urged people to maintain peace.

123.title: Soldier's wife hacked to death at Punjab home, axe found near body
123.article_body: A 38-year-old soldier found his wife hacked to death at their home in Punjab after he returned on Friday following his retirement, police said. "My wife was attacked on...face with...sharp-edged weapon. I found a blood-stained axe near...body," Jasbir Singh said in his complaint. Police said that the woman had no enmity with anyone and they are investigating from various angles.

124.title: Nepal's electricity supply to India to rise significantly: Official
124.article_body: The supply of electricity from Nepal to India will be enhanced significantly in 2022 as compared to the previous year, Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla said on Saturday. Shringla made the remark after a meeting between PM Narendra Modi and Nepal's PM Sher Bahadur Deuba today. Both sides discussed harnessing water resources for mutual benefits, he added.

125.title: See the respect given to Indian passport: Pak PM while praising India's foreign policy
125.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has praised India's foreign policy. "Look at the foreign policy of India. When there was cold war between Soviet Union and the US, they remained non-aligned," he said. "Because of India's foreign policy, see the respect given to the passport of India and the respect given to Pakistan passport," Khan added.

126.title: AAP is a party without ideology, it only shows dreams to people: Cong
126.article_body: Congress Himachal Pradesh President Kuldeep Rathore on Saturday called Aam Aadmi Party a party without an ideology that only shows dreams to people. He added that a direct competition between Congress and Bharatiya Janata Party will take place in the Assembly elections in the state. Notably, AAP had said that it'll contest all 68 seats in the Himachal Pradesh elections.

127.title: Meteorologist in US pauses live telecast to call family about tornado warning
127.article_body: A meteorologist in the US paused his live broadcast on television to call his family to check if they knew about a nearby tornado warning. Sharing a video of his incident, Doug Kammerer wrote, "Had to warn my family! Kids were home alone and I knew they were not watching me on TV!...Scary moment for me though."

128.title: At least 20 dead bodies spotted lying on Ukrainian street; video surfaces
128.article_body: At least 20 dead bodies were spotted lying on a street in Ukrainian town of Bucha after Russian strikes. A video showed that one of the bodies had his hands tied and the corpses were strewn over several hundred metres of the residential road. Ukrainian forces reportedly retook the town of Bucha.

129.title: Ukrainian journalist killed covering Russia-Ukraine conflict
129.article_body: A Ukrainian journalist, Maksim Levin, has been found dead in a village north of the Ukrainian capital Kyiv after going missing more than two weeks ago. The prosecutor general's office in Ukraine said that Levin was "killed by servicemen of the Russian Armed Forces with two shots from small arms". He is survived by his wife and four children.

130.title: Pic shows Malaika Arora's damaged car after accident
130.article_body: A picture of Malaika Arora's damaged car after a road accident, in which three vehicles rammed into each other, has surfaced online. While the front and the last vehicles were tourist cars, Arora was in her Range Rover in between both the cars. She was rushed to the hospital after she reportedly received an injury near her eye.

131.title: Wear mask as long as Ajit Pawar and I continue to wear it: Maha CM
131.article_body: Days after Maharashtra government said it isn't mandatory to wear masks, CM Uddhav Thackeray urged people to wear masks for as long as he and his deputy Ajit Pawar continue to wear them. "I saw most people didn't wear masks...The...two people who have continued wearing masks...(are) me and Pawar...I would urge people to continue to cover their faces," he said.

132.title: It's a joke: Tharoor as pic of him as 'child actor' goes viral on April Fool's Day
132.article_body: After film writer Vaibhav Vishal's picture claiming to show Congress MP Shashi Tharoor as a "child star" on April Fool's Day went viral, the MP on Saturday clarified, "It's a joke!" He added, "He's pulling my leg and I am playing along for fun." Tharoor had earlier commented on the picture, "I'd tried to keep it secret...Good sleuthing."

133.title: It's not always easy: Shardul on playing for DC after 4 years with CSK
133.article_body: Speaking about moving to DC after playing for CSK for four years, all-rounder Shardul Thakur said it's not always easy. "It's a different management altogether here, so [I'm] getting used to it...it has been an honour to work with these guys," he added. Shardul was bought by DC for ₹10.75 crore in IPL mega auction 2022 in February.

134.title: Revolutionary move: Rijiju on withdrawal of AFSPA from NE areas
134.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Saturday called the Centre's decision to withdraw AFSPA from major areas of Assam, Nagaland and Manipur a "revolutionary move". The minister said, "When AFSPA is withdrawn, it means that peace has returned to that area." He added that the development that the Northeast has seen under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi is "historic".

135.title: Once he gets fit, he comes straight in MI playing XI: Rohit on Suryakumar
135.article_body: On being asked whether batter Suryakumar Yadav will play for MI in their next match after their second straight loss in IPL 2022, skipper Rohit Sharma said, "He's a key player for us." He added, "Once he gets fit, he comes in straight but we want him to recover since finger injuries are tricky." MI was defeated by RR today.

136.title: Delighted 44th FIDE Chess Olympiad is happening in India: Anand
136.article_body: Five-time world chess champion Viswanathan Anand said he's delighted with India winning the bid to host 44th FIDE Chess Olympiad 2022. "Full credit to Tamil Nadu government and All India Chess Federation (AICF) for moving so fast," he added. Notably, Chess Olympiad will be held in India for first time and will take place in July-August in Anand's hometown Chennai.

137.title: 'RRR' writer deserves Padma Vibhushan, Rajamouli is king: Kangana
137.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut shared a video on Instagram appreciating 'RRR', saying writer KV Vijayendra Prasad deserves India's second-highest civilian honour Padma Vibhushan. "At the age of 80, he is one of India's busiest writers. He writes in 15 days while others take years to complete a story," she said. Kangana further called SS Rajamouli a king for making the film.

138.title: Ukraine's gold, forex reserves stand at pre-war level: Official
138.article_body: A senior Ukrainian official on Saturday announced that Ukraine's gold and foreign currency reserves stand at $29 billion, the same level as before Russia's invasion. The reserves have remained at the pre-war level mainly due to external financial support for the country. The reserves had dropped to $27.5 billion before rising to the current level, the official said.

139.title: Malaika Arora admitted to hospital after car accident
139.article_body: Malaika Arora was taken to the Apollo hospital for treatment after she received injury near her eye in a pile-up between vehicles near Mumbai. Three vehicles rammed onto each other and all three vehicles have received damages. The police have made a mention of the incident and an FIR will be registered after investigating how the accident happened.

140.title: 2 civilians shot at by Army mistakenly in Arunachal Pradesh
140.article_body: Two civilians were injured by the Army in Arunachal Pradesh's Tirap district on Friday in a case of mistaken identity. They were returning home after fishing in a river. "The visibility was not clear...When the army fired, the boys started shouting that they were civilians and not to shoot them," Tirap DC said. They were taken to Assam for treatment.

141.title: Putin bathes in blood from deer antlers, cancer doctor accompanied him on trips: Report
141.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin takes bath in blood extracted from deer antlers to boost his health, a Russian news outlet reported. It also reported that Putin took frequent trips to the resort city of Sochi in the company of oncology surgeon specialising in thyroid cancer several times in last four years. The antlers are reportedly cut while deer are alive.

142.title: UK watchdog suspends Khalsa TV licence over Khalistani propaganda
142.article_body: The UK's media watchdog, the Office of Communications (Ofcom), on Saturday announced that it has suspended the broadcast licence of Khalsa Television Limited. The order was issued over KTV channel's broadcast of a programme that promoted Khalistani propaganda. The content "promoted violent action, including murder, as...acceptable...form of action to further the Khalistani cause", Ofcom said.

143.title: BJP full of arrogance, give AAP a chance in Gujarat: Kejriwal
143.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, who held a roadshow in Ahmedabad on Saturday ahead of Gujarat polls scheduled for later this year, said BJP has become arrogant after being in power for 25 years. He urged people to give a chance to Aam Aadmi Party. "If you do not like it, change the government and bring them back," Kejriwal said.

144.title: Woman uses her red saree to signal train to stop after seeing broken track in UP
144.article_body: A woman in UP's Etah prevented a train accident by hanging her red saree on railway track to signal a train to stop after noticing damage to the track. Pictures from the incident showed the saree propped up in the middle of the track with the help of wooden sticks. The train going to Tudla stopped after getting the signal.

145.title: Woman ordered to pay alimony to her ex-husband by Bombay HC
145.article_body: Bombay High Court has upheld orders passed by a local court in Maharashtra's Nanded, directing a woman teacher to pay alimony to her former husband. The man claimed that he had no source of income and he suffered from some health issues that had rendered him unfit for working. The local court had directed her to pay maintenance of ₹3,000/month.

146.title: Who are the world's 10 richest people as Adani enters $100 billion club?
146.article_body: Elon Musk is the world's richest person with $273 billion fortune, Bloomberg said, followed by Jeff Bezos ($188 billion). While Gautam Adani is 10th richest with $100 billion wealth, the list includes Bernard Arnault ($148 billion), Bill Gates ($133 billion) and Warren Buffett ($127 billion). Google Co-founders Larry Page ($125 billion) and Sergey Brin ($119 billion) rank sixth and seventh.

147.title: I'm a big screen hero, don't want to step into OTT: John Abraham
147.article_body: Actor John Abraham has stated that he is a big screen hero and only wants to be seen on the big screen. "There's nothing wrong with it but I don't think I am ready for [stepping into OTT] today," the actor added. He further said that he has no problem even if he fails but only on the big screen.

148.title: 'Mahabharat' actor Rohit Bhardwaj announces separation from wife after 16 yrs of marriage
148.article_body: Television actor Rohit Bhardwaj, best known for playing Yudhishthira in 'Mahabharat', has revealed that he is separating from his wife Poonam Bhardwaj after 16 years of marriage. "The divorce is in the process and should be through in two months," he stated. Rohit further said he hasn't seen his daughter in two years.

149.title: Tom Hanks officiates couple's wedding in their unfinished home in US, pics surface
149.article_body: Actor Tom Hanks officiated a couple’s wedding in their unfinished house in Pittsburgh after the bride wrote a letter to him requesting if he would perform the ceremony. Krisna Poznik had been engaged to her partner for nearly five years and recalled Hanks doing something similar for a couple in 2016. Notably, Tom Hanks is an ordained minister.

150.title: TN CM and DMK chief MK Stalin inaugurates party's new office in Delhi
150.article_body: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) chief and Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday inaugurated the party's new office 'Anna-Kalaignar Arivalayam' in Delhi at Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg. Congress leader Sonia Gandhi was also present during the inauguration. Notably, Stalin, who's on a three-day visit to Delhi, visited government schools and mohalla clinics with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday.

151.title: Warring parties agree to 2-month truce in Yemen: UN
151.article_body: The warring sides in Yemen have agreed to a two-month nationwide truce from Saturday, the UN envoy to Yemen said. The deal between Yemen's government, backed by a Saudi-led military coalition, and Houthi rebels aims "to give Yemenis a necessary break from violence", the UN envoy added. Notably, Saturday marks the start of the Muslim holy month of Ramzan.

152.title: Haryana makes masks optional, no fine for not wearing them in public
152.article_body: Amid a dip in coronavirus cases, the Haryana government, led by CM ML Khattar, issued an order on Saturday saying that it's no longer mandatory to wear masks in public places and workplaces. It added that those not wearing masks won't be fined ₹500. However, the general public was advised to follow coronavirus-appropriate behaviour, use face masks and hand sanitisers.

153.title: Man crashes his ₹2.5 crore Ferrari just after buying it in UK; pic goes viral
153.article_body: A man in the UK's Derby crashed his brand new Ferrari worth around ₹2.5 crore just after buying it. Photos shared by police show the front bonnet crumpled with scratches all across the front of the car. "Driver bought a Ferrari this morning and crashed it after driving it less than 2 miles. No injuries. #DriveToArrive," police wrote.

154.title: What is known about the new COVID-19 variant 'XE' that WHO has warned against?
154.article_body: WHO has issued a warning against the 'XE' variant of COVID-19, which is a hybrid of two sublineages of the Omicron variant- BA.1 and BA.2. First detected in the UK on January 19, the 'XE' variant's rate of infection has been found in preliminary studies to be 10% higher than that of BA.2 (considered most contagious till now), WHO said.

155.title: Delhi & Punjab done, ready for Guj: Mann in roadshow with Kejriwal
155.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal held a roadshow in Ahmedabad ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls scheduled for later this year. "Delhi and Punjab sorted, now we are ready for Gujarat," Mann said. Kejriwal claimed he ended corruption in Delhi. "I don't know how to do politics but...know how to end corruption," he said.

156.title: Chris Rock's fan shouts 'f**k Will Smith' during his show, comedian replies 'No, no'
156.article_body: Comedian Chris Rock stopped a fan who was abusing Will Smith during a live performance in Boston on Thursday, according to People magazine. "No, no, no, no, no," Chris Rock immediately replied. At Rock's shows on Wednesday, his first appearance since presenting at the Academy Awards where he was slapped by Smith, he said he was "still processing what happened".

157.title: At least 35 killed in strike on Ukraine's Mykolaiv: Governor
157.article_body: At least 35 people were killed in a rocket strike on a regional administration building in Ukraine's Mykolaiv. Reportedly, rescue workers have continued to dismantle the rubble and search for victims after the rocket strike. Meanwhile, at least 1,276 civilians including 115 children were killed in Ukraine since Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

158.title: Cameraman gets hit by six from MI's Tilak Varma, Trent Boult's reaction goes viral
158.article_body: Mumbai Indians batting all-rounder Tilak Varma smashed a six over long-off on the bowling of Rajasthan Royals' Riyan Parag, which went on to hit a cameraman. The reaction of RR fast bowler Trent Boult, who was fielding at long-off, went viral. Boult was seen putting hands on his head before checking up on the cameraman.

159.title: 5-time champions MI lose two matches in a row as RR register 2nd straight win
159.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) defeated five-time champions Mumbai Indians (MI) by 23 runs to register their second straight win in IPL 2022. MI have now lost their first two matches in IPL 2022. The match witnessed RR opener Jos Buttler becoming the first batter to slam a hundred in IPL 2022. Buttler scored 100(68), including 11 fours and five sixes.

160.title: Ready-to-eat popcorn to attract 18% GST, clarifies Telangana AAR
160.article_body: Ready-to-eat popcorn is prepared by swelling maize corn and should attract 18% GST, Telangana Authority for Advanced Ruling (AAR) has clarified. It noted that ready-to-eat popcorn falls under the category of prepared foods obtained by swelling or roasting of cereals or cereal products. It "clearly does not fall under" the category pertaining to preparations of vegetables, fruits, nuts, it added.

161.title: How's the Jos, very high sir: Mishra after Buttler hit 1st ton of IPL 2022
161.article_body: Following RR opener Jos Buttler's 68-ball 100 against MI in IPL 2022, ex-DC spinner Amit Mishra tweeted, "How's the Jos...high, very high sir! A deadly display of batting by Buttler, just like we all expect him to do." He added, "First century of IPL 2022. Heart goes out for the bowlers who have to bowl him in such scorching heat."

162.title: South Africa crosses 1 lakh COVID-19 deaths since pandemic began
162.article_body: South Africa's National Institute for Communicable Diseases on Friday said the country reported 1,00,020 deaths since the pandemic began. However, the government still plans to lift the lockdown restrictions soon. Deputy President David Mabuza said government has no plans to introduce a mandatory COVID-19 vaccine policy in the country. Meanwhile, South Africa logged 1,692 cases on Friday.

163.title: Sudan's miltary leader who led coup threatens to expel UN envoy
163.article_body: Sudan's military leader General Abdel Fattah al-Burhan on Friday threatened to expel UN special representative Volker Perthes, accusing him of overstepping the mandate. "We heard his slander the other day, lying, blatantly lying," said al-Burhan. This comes after Perthes warned Sudan was heading for "an economic and security collapse". Sudan plunged into crisis after last year's military coup.

164.title: Israeli troops kill 3 Palestinians in a raid in occupied West Bank
164.article_body: Israeli forces on Saturday said three members of Palestinian Islamic Jihad were killed during a raid in the occupied West Bank near the city of Jenin. As per a statement by the Israeli police, three Palestinians were killed when they opened fire on Israeli troops leading to a shoot-out. They added that four soldiers were wounded in the operation.

165.title: Becoming director as you're not good-looking to be star not a reason: Karan
165.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has condemned those who become directors because they weren't "good-looking enough" to become movie stars. "That cannot be the reason why you are a director. It cannot be your plan B," the filmmaker added. He further said that aspiring directors must be familiar with the work of great directors like Pedro Almodóvar, SS Rajamouli and Steven Spielberg.

166.title: Mali's military kills over 200 Islamic militants in Moura region
166.article_body: Mali's military on Friday said they killed 203 Islamic militants during an operation carried out in Moura region in March. "This operation follows very precise information that made it possible to locate the holding of a meeting between various militants in Moura," a military statement said. The military added they arrested 51 people and seized large quantities of weapons too.

167.title: We seek to expand relations with US: Pak Army chief after PM's 'foreign conspiracy' claim
167.article_body: Pakistan's army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa has said his country sought to expand its relationship with US, a day after Pakistan protested to the US embassy over alleged interference in its internal affairs. PM Imran Khan had said that Pakistan gave a protest note to the embassy over what he described as foreign conspiracy to oust him from power.

168.title: Hopefully I can put on a display for DC fans: Powell ahead of DC vs GT
168.article_body: Ahead of Delhi Capitals-Gujarat Titans in IPL 2022, DC batter Rovman Powell, who was out for a duck in his side's first match, said he's looking forward to scoring some runs. "Hopefully, I can put on a display for the Delhi Capitals fans," he added. The match will be played today at Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune.

169.title: DC to field first against GT, playing XIs announced
169.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to field first against GT in their IPL 2022 match at the Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune. GT are fielding the same playing XI, while Kamlesh Nagarkoti has been replaced by Mustafizur Rahman in DC's playing XI. Notably, both the teams had won their opening matches in IPL 2022.

170.title: Akshay Kumar was never approached for 'The Kashmir Files': Producer
170.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' producer Abhishek Agarwal has revealed that actor Akshay Kumar was never approached for the film. He further said neither he nor director Vivek Agnihotri thought about the commercial aspect of the film, adding that the cast features performers and not stars. "Vivek was...very specific so we brought Darshan (Kumaar) on board [to portray Krishna Pandit]," Abhishek added.

171.title: My directorial debut 'F.A.L.T.U' was a big deal for me: Remo
171.article_body: Choreographer-director Remo D'souza has stated that his directorial debut 'F.A.L.T.U' was a big deal for him in many ways. He further said that the word 'faltu' (useless) was attached to him since he was young. "It was my way of telling...naysayers that no life choice made by anyone is ever 'faltu' especially when those are the unconventional ones," Remo added.

172.title: Cyberabad Police announces short film contest on drug abuse theme
172.article_body: The Cyberabad Police has announced a short film contest on the theme 'Spreading Awareness on Drug Abuse'. Sharing the registration link on Twitter, the force informed that participants can submit 60 to 120 second-long videos in English, Hindi or Telugu with subtitles. The first prize winner will get ₹50,000 while second and third will receive ₹30,000 and ₹20,000 respectively.

173.title: Restoration of Hyderabad's Kali Kaman completed, pictures released
173.article_body: The restoration work at Kali Kaman, one of the four arches near Hyderabad's Charminar, has been completed. The before and after photos of the Kaman were shared on Twitter by Telangana Special Chief Secretary, Municipal Administration, Arvind Kumar on Saturday. The project was undertaken by the municipal corporation and Telangana Heritage Department last year and reportedly cost ₹1.48 crore.

174.title: Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray flags off Metro lines 2A and 7 in Mumbai
174.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray inaugurated two Metro lines in Mumbai on the occasion of Gudi Padwa on Saturday. The lines will begin full operations on April 3 with Metro 2A, running from Dahisar west to DN Nagar and Metro 7, from Dahisar east to Andheri east. There are around 60 drivers to operate the trains, MMRDA Commissioner, SVR Srinivas, said.

175.title: Manipur to honour Irom Sharmila for 16-yr-long anti-AFSPA movement
