175.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh has said the state government will honour Irom Chanu Sharmila for her 16-year-long hunger strike against the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA). "I...appreciate...Sharmila who sacrificed half of her life staging dharna," Singh said. She started her hunger strike in 2000 after 10 civilians were allegedly killed by security forces. Her strike ended in 2016.

176.title: Himalaya clarifies on its halal policy after users call for #BoycottHimalaya
176.article_body: Himalaya on Friday issued a statement after a group of people started to call for #BoycottHimalaya over its halal policy. The company said, "None of the Himalaya products contain meat, as alleged in some of the social media platforms; this is factually incorrect." It added, that halal certification "does not imply that a product contains animal-derived ingredients."

177.title: ₹1.29 cr siphoned off from dead doctor's bank account in Mumbai
177.article_body: Two former housekeeping staff members of the SBI Goregaon branch allegedly siphoned off ₹1.29 crore from the bank account of a Kolkata-based doctor, who had died in 2014. The accused, who reportedly entered the bank during the lockdown on the pretext of cleaning, accessed the bank's systems, updated KYC and changed the mobile number linked to the account.

178.title: Mumbai's 'Sunday Streets' to be hosted at 3 more locations
178.article_body: After 'Sunday Streets' was held at six locations in the city last week, Mumbai Police decided to add three more roads that will be made traffic-free for a few hours every Sunday. From April 3, people will also be able to engage in fun activities on streets of Chembur's Chimni garden, Dahisar's IC Colony and Kandivali's Thakur Village.

179.title: 4-team series involving India, Pakistan can bring in revenue of ₹5,000 crore: PCB
179.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) said their proposed four-team T20I tournament involving India, Pakistan, England and Australia can bring in revenue of around ₹5,000 crore for the four participants as well as the ICC. Pakistan will formally present the proposal at the ICC Board meeting next week in Dubai. "It will become a much-anticipated event," a PCB official told ESPNcricinfo.

180.title: 7 bus drivers fined on 1st day of lane discipline drive in Delhi
180.article_body: Seven drivers of DTC and cluster buses were fined ₹10,000 each on Friday, the first day of the lane discipline enforcement drive. The first violation will attract a fine of ₹10,000, the second will invite prosecution under the Motor Vehicles Act, the third will get the driving licence suspended and the fourth will lead to termination of the vehicle's permit.

181.title: I grew up watching Ajay Devgn, he was superstar then & now: Jr NTR
181.article_body: Actor Jr NTR has stated that he has grown up watching actor Ajay Devgn's films. "He was our very own action superstar then and he is now," the actor added. He further said that Ajay's entry standing on two bikes in 'Phool Aur Kaante' was crazy for him, adding that he used to wonder if he can do it.

182.title: Aren't your words extreme? Jungkook to troll saying 'Eat dog sh*t'
182.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS' member Jungkook held an 'ask me anything' session on Instagram during which a social media user wrote, "Are you bored? Eat dog sh*t." Jungkook responded to the user writing, "Aren't your words really extreme? If you crumble up choco pie, the shape looks similar." He is quarantined in Las Vegas after testing positive for COVID-19.

183.title: Sri Lanka imposes nationwide curfew till Monday amid economic crisis
183.article_body: The Sri Lankan government on Saturday imposed a nationwide curfew until Monday morning amid growing unrest in the country due to a severe economic crisis. Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa had imposed a state of emergency earlier this week after public protests over the crisis turned violent. The crisis has led to a shortage of essential items in the country.

184.title: Joss the boss: Harbhajan on Buttler being 1st player to hit 100 in IPL 2022
184.article_body: After Jos Buttler became the first player to score a century in IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter and said, "Joss the boss...what a 100 Buttler, class." The RR opener scored 100 off 68 balls against MI at DY Patil Stadium, Mumbai. He hit 11 fours and five sixes during his ton. RR scored 193/8 in 20 overs.

185.title: Akhilesh Yadav's uncle Shivpal starts following PM, UP CM on Twitter
185.article_body: Amid reports of a rift with his nephew and SP President Akhilesh Yadav, PSPL chief Shivpal Yadav on Saturday started following PM Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Twitter. Notably, this comes after Yadav met CM Adityanath in Lucknow on Wednesday. Earlier, Yadav had claimed he was not invited to the SP Legislature Party meeting.

186.title: Employee holding civil post has to act with utmost good faith: SC
186.article_body: Supreme Court has said that an employee desirous of holding a civil post has to act with utmost good faith and truthfulness. The remarks came as the court upheld the sacking of a teacher for not disclosing a criminal case registered against him in the official forms. The man had joined as a trained graduate teacher of mathematics in Delhi.

187.title: Oscars Academy accepts Smith's resignation, to continue with disciplinary proceedings
187.article_body: David Rubin, president of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, has said that the Academy has accepted Will Smith's resignation following the Oscars slapping incident. "We'll continue to move forward with our disciplinary proceedings against Mr Smith for violations of the Academy's Standards of Conduct, in advance of our next scheduled board meeting on April 18," he added.

188.title: Scientists to send pic depicting naked man & woman to space for aliens
188.article_body: Scientists have developed a binary-coded new message, which includes a representation of naked man and woman, that will be beamed to aliens that might exist in the Milky Way. "The proposed message includes basic mathematical and physical concepts...The message concludes with digitised images of the human form, along with an invitation for any receiving intelligences to respond," they said.

189.title: PM Modi gifts miniature painting from Himachal to Nepal PM Deuba, pic released
189.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has gifted a miniature painting from Himachal Pradesh to Nepalese PM Sher Bahadur Deuba, during the latter's first visit to India as PM. The traditional 'Pahari School' painting depicts the season of monsoon. It shows Lord Krishna and Radha holding hands and it's representative of the painting style that originated in Kangra.

190.title: Ariana Grande pledges to donate $1.5mn to fight anti-trans bills
190.article_body: Singer Ariana Grande has pledged to match up to $1.5 million (almost ₹11.4 crore) in donations to LGBTQ advocacy groups amid the anti-trans rights bills in the US state legislature. She wrote on Instagram, "Right now there are hundreds of disgraceful bills pending in state legislature that target trans youth and aim to curb their rights."

191.title: Imposter befriends Mumbai woman on Facebook, cheats her of ₹15 lakh
191.article_body: An imposter allegedly defrauded a 42-year-old Mumbai businesswoman of ₹15.6 lakh. The accused reportedly posed as a UK businessman on Facebook initially and told the victim he was sending a gift. He later called her pretending to be a customs official and asked her to pay a penalty against the gift and $70,000 that had arrived at the airport.

192.title: Pradeep Mehra receives ₹2.5 lakh from Shoppers Stop, Kapri shares post
192.article_body: Shoppers Stop has given a cheque of ₹2.5 lakh to 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra for his mother’s treatment and to accomplish his dream of joining the Indian Army. Filmmaker Vinod Kapri tweeted about this and wrote, "Midnight runner Pradeep Mehra is overwhelmed with all the love and support." Earlier in March, Mehra's video of running in Noida had gone viral.

193.title: Commendable: Raina on GT skipper Hardik's comeback as bowler in IPL
193.article_body: Calling Hardik Pandya's comeback as a bowler in his side's five-wicket win against LSG in IPL 2022 "commendable", ex-CSK player Suresh Raina said GT skipper is looking fit. Irfan Pathan praised Hardik and said he's not putting much strain on his back as he's not trying to bend a lot while releasing the ball. Hardik registered bowling figures of 4-0-37-0.

194.title: 6-yr-old girl on picnic dies after she slips & falls into pool in Mumbai
194.article_body: A six-year-old girl, who was on a picnic with her family, died after she slipped and drowned in a swimming pool on the eve of Gudi-Padwa at a private bungalow in Uttan near Mumbai. According to police, the deceased girl's parents were having breakfast when the incident took place. Meanwhile, police have registered an accidental death report into the matter.

195.title: Cooperation in Space possible only after removal of sanctions: Russia
195.article_body: Roscosmos Director General Dmitry Rogozin on Saturday said restoration of normal relations between the partners at the International Space Station (ISS) and other projects would be possible only once Western sanctions against Moscow are lifted. He added that plans to end cooperation over ISS with space agencies of US, Canada, EU and Japan will soon be reported to Russian authorities.

196.title: India to export 40,000 tonnes of rice to Sri Lanka amid its economic crisis
196.article_body: India is set to export 40,000 tonnes of rice to Sri Lanka amid the latter’s economic crisis. The 40,000-tonne shipment is part of the 3,00,000 tonnes India will supply to Sri Lanka in the next few months. Notably, Sri Lanka has announced a state of emergency after violent protests erupted over food and fuel shortages in the country.

197.title: US sanctions 5 North Korean firms over recent ballistic missile tests
197.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on five North Korean entities for supporting "North Korea's development of weapons of mass destruction and ballistic missile programmes". The move follows recent missile tests by North Korea, including its first intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) launch since 2017. "These...tests are brazen violations of multiple UN Security Council resolutions," the US said.

198.title: We expect good news over the weekend on Mariupol evacuations: Ukraine
198.article_body: Ukrainian Presidential Advisor Oleksiy Arestovych on Saturday said the government expects good news over the weekend regarding evacuation of the inhabitants of the besieged city of Mariupol. "Our delegation has reached an agreement in Istanbul (during Ukraine-Russia peace talks) to provide evacuations," Arestovych added. Meanwhile, at least 1,276 civilians were killed in Ukraine till March 31.

199.title: Russia registers world's first nasal COVID-19 vaccine
199.article_body: Russian Health Ministry on Friday registered world's first nasal version of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine. Gamaleya Research Centre Director Alexander Gintsburg said the vaccine will be available within three to four months. He added that the vaccine will be efficient against Omicron variant. Meanwhile, Russia reported 17,949 new cases and 340 deaths in the last 24 hours.

200.title: India beat Wales 5-1 in their opening game of women's junior hockey WC
200.article_body: India started their FIH Hockey Women's Junior World Cup campaign with a win over Wales by 5-1 in Potchefstroom, South Africa on Saturday. The scorers for India in the Group D clash were Lalremsiami, Lalrindiki, Deepika and Mumtaz Khan. Indian captain and midfielder Salima Tete was adjudged the player of the match.

201.title: There are some nerves ahead of Women's World Cup final: Meg Lanning
201.article_body: Australia captain Meg Lanning feels that there are "some nerves" in her team's camp ahead of their ICC Women's World Cup final against England on Sunday. “There are certainly some nerves around I think it would be crazy if you weren’t nervous heading into a WC final, so it’s a good thing. But there’s a lot of excitement," Lanning said.

202.title: UN climate science panel to focus on cutting greenhouse gas emissions
202.article_body: UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) on Monday said its final report will focus on ways of curbing greenhouse gas emissions. While report is published, it will only be released after 195 governments will ratify the its findings as well as its summary. Experts warned this consensual nature of the report could diverge from the most dramatic warnings.

203.title: Planning for security for Amarnath Yatra done: J&K Police DGP
203.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Director General of Police Dilbag Singh said on Saturday that planning for preparations and security for Amarnath Yatra is done. "An analysis of number of devotees coming this year for the yatra has been done too," he added. The pilgrimage to the Himalayan shrine of Amarnath will begin on June 30 and will end on August 11.

204.title: Big achievement: KKR's Russell on his eight-sixes vs PBKS
204.article_body: Describing his eight-sixes during his unbeaten knock of 70 off 31 balls in KKR's six-wicket win against PBKS in IPL 2022 as "big achievement", KKR all-rounder Andre Russell said it's good for him. "I'm looking to do much better. In past games I have [hit] 14 sixes...I'm happy to close off the innings as well," he added.

205.title: Ukraine's economy could contract 40% in 2022: Economy Ministry
205.article_body: The Ukrainian economy could shrink by 40% in 2022 due to the Russian invasion of the country, Ukraine's Ministry of Economy said in a statement on Saturday. "Areas in which remote work is impossible have suffered the most," it added. The economy contracted 16% year-on-year in the first quarter of this year, according to the ministry.

206.title: Bengaluru CCB arrests 2 men, seizes lethal weapons from them
206.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru City Police has apprehended a man and his accomplice within the Vyalikaval Police Station limits, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime) said in a tweet on Saturday. According to information, the crime branch has also seized lethal weapons from the possession of the arrested persons.

207.title: PM Modi holds talks with Nepal PM, discusses 'blueprint of future'
207.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday met his Nepalese counterpart Sher Bahadur Deuba at Hyderabad House in New Delhi. "We...reviewed the progress of various projects and also discussed the blueprint of the future," PM Modi said. In the meeting, both the PMs jointly inaugurated a cross-border rail network between Jaynagar in Bihar and Nepal's Kurtha and signed four Memorandums of Understanding.

208.title: 12 killed in blasts at playground in Afghanistan's Herat
208.article_body: At least 12 people were killed and 25 others were injured in two bomb blasts at a playground in Afghanistan's Herat, according to reports. The number of children killed or injured in the blasts was not mentioned in the latest reports. A local Taliban official claimed that the bombs must have been planted at the ground recently.

209.title: Jos Buttler becomes first batter to slam a hundred in IPL 2022
209.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) opener Jos Buttler has become the first batter to smash a hundred in IPL 2022. The 31-year-old, who is playing in his 300th T20 match, reached the three-figure mark against Mumbai Indians (MI) off 66 deliveries. It is Buttler's second hundred in IPL, with this first coming against SRH in IPL 2021.

210.title: I'll keep acting till I die: Sanjay on shooting film post cancer treatment
210.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt opened up about his experience of shooting for film post his cancer treatment. "I'm an artist and till the day I die, I'll keep acting if God permits me to," he said. The actor further said that he feels proud to be a part of the industry. Sanjay Dutt will be next seen in 'KGF: Chapter 2'.

211.title: Saisha Shinde apologises to Kangana after eviction from 'Lock Upp'
211.article_body: Designer Saisha Shinde took to Instagram to share a series of pictures of actress Kangana Ranaut in her outfits to apologise to her. This comes after she was eliminated from Kangana's reality show 'Lock Upp' following an argument between the two. "I ended up disrespecting you...I'm sorry [because] all I wanted was to be a version of you," Saisha wrote.

212.title: India were a long way out, Gary told me 'Dhoni will fetch the WC': Upton
212.article_body: Discussing MS Dhoni's promotion up the order in the 2011 World Cup final, ex-India mental conditioning coach Paddy Upton said India were still a "long way out" from winning the World Cup when Dhoni walked out. "I remember turning to India's head coach Gary Kirsten who said 'MS is going out there to fetch us the trophy'," added Upton.

213.title: US Senator probes hackers' forged legal requests to Apple, Meta
213.article_body: US Senator Ron Wyden has requested information from technology firms and government agencies about the recent forged legal requests by hackers to firms including Meta and Apple. Wyden called reports of the forged requests an "enormous threat to Americans' safety and national security". He also raised concerns that the requests could be coming from "compromised foreign law enforcement agencies".

214.title: Girl apologises to inquiry panel after row over offering namaz in MP classroom
214.article_body: Days after a girl wearing hijab was purportedly seen offering namaz inside a classroom of Madhya Pradesh's Dr Harisingh Gour University, the student has tendered a written apology to an inquiry committee established by the university to probe the matter. The girl claimed that she offered namaz in the classroom unintentionally as she was getting late in reaching the hostel.

215.title: It's a story close to my heart: Shakun on series on Osho, Ma Anand Sheela
215.article_body: Filmmaker Shakun Batra, who had announced a series on the life of spiritual leader Osho or Bhagwan Rajneesh and his secretary Ma Anand Sheela, has shared an update on the project. "It's a story very close to my heart...It's something I do want to venture back to...I don't know the timing of it...But it remains close to me," he said.

216.title: Shah Rukh Khan is responsible for where I am today: John Abraham
216.article_body: Actor John Abraham, while talking about his 'Pathaan' co-star Shah Rukh Khan, said the latter is responsible for where he has reached in life. "Shah Rukh Khan is...responsible for where I am because when I started modelling he was the judge in the show," John said. John further added that he has a lot of respect for the actor.

217.title: If RR put up a big score, MI may find it difficult to chase: Azharuddin
217.article_body: After MI won the toss against RR in IPL 2022 and chose to bowl first, ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said if RR put up a big target then MI may find it difficult to chase. He added that RR have a strong bowling line-up with "quality" spinners like Ravichandran Ashwin and Yuzvendra Chahal. RR won their opener by 61 runs.

218.title: The Undertaker breaks down in ring during WWE Hall of Fame event, pics surface
218.article_body: The Undertaker, who had announced his retirement from WWE in 2020, broke down inside the ring during WWE Hall of Fame event. The Undertaker received standing ovation as he was inducted into the Hall of Fame. Following his speech, The Undertaker also wore his iconic coat and hat and said, "Never say never," seemingly teasing a return to the ring.

219.title: 7 dead, 14 injured as truck falls into valley in Tamil Nadu's Tirupathur
219.article_body: As many as seven people died and 14 were injured after a truck they were travelling in fell into a valley in a village in Tamil Nadu's Tirupathur on Saturday. The truck's driver, while negotiating a curve, lost control of the vehicle leading to the accident, police said. The victims were on their way to a temple, police added.

220.title: Maharashtra Home Minister orders probe into death of NCB's witness
220.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Saturday ordered police to investigate the death of Prabhakar Sail, an NCB witness in the cruise drugs case linked to Aryan Khan. "How could such a strong and healthy man die suddenly?" he asked. Sail died of a heart attack at his Chembur home and his family members don't suspect foul play.

221.title: 15-yr-old rape survivor tied to a pole & beaten by accused & his family in Odisha
221.article_body: A 15-year-old girl who was allegedly raped by her 20-year-old neighbour was tied to a pole and beaten by the accused and his family members for filing a police complaint in Odisha's Nayagarh, police said. The incident took place when the girl's father went to file the complaint. The accused and seven others, including five women, have been arrested.

222.title: Properties of 5 persons accused of planning blasts in Jaipur demolished in MP
222.article_body: The district administration in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam demolished properties belonging to five of the six persons accused of planning bomb blasts in Jaipur. The accused were recently arrested in Ratlam and Rajasthan's Chittorgarh. "Illegal encroachments by these offenders were demolished. The action will continue against several other sympathisers as well," Ratlam Collector Kumar Purushottam said.

223.title: Pak PM says 'mai', 'mujhe', 'mera' 213 times in address to nation; video viral
223.article_body:
Amid political crisis, Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan addressed the nation on Thursday night. 
Sharing a montage of his 45-minute speech, journalist Hamid Mir counted every time Khan said the words 'mai', 'mujhe' and 'mera'. Later, Geo News reported that he mentioned himself 213 times in total. The clip went viral with people calling Khan a "narcissist".

224.title: Natascha Sharma announces pregnancy, shares pics with baby bump
224.article_body: Television actress Natascha Sharma, known for portraying Sia in 'Na Aana Iss Des Laado', took to Instagram to announce her pregnancy and uploaded a series of pictures showing her baby bump. She captioned one of the pictures, "It's time to embrace motherhood." The pictures from Natascha's maternity photoshoot were clicked by her husband actor Aditya Redij.

225.title: Shahid Kapoor buys Mercedes-Maybach worth ₹3cr, shares video
225.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor on Saturday took to Instagram to share a video of his new Mercedes-Maybach S580 worth ₹3 crore. He captioned his post, "Falling bach." The actor had bought the car on the occasion of his 41st birthday. This is not his first Mercedes-Benz S-Class as Shahid has earlier been spotted driving a Mercedes-Benz S400 (previous-generation S-Class).

226.title: Petrol to cost ₹275/litre by next elections: Akhilesh on 'math of BJP inflation'
226.article_body: Samajwadi Party supremo Akhilesh Yadav criticised the Centre for increasing the fuel prices for the tenth time in 12 days and explained the "math of BJP inflation". "People are saying that at the (monthly) rate of... ₹24, if petrol prices keep increasing, then by the time the next elections are held in November-December... (petrol) will cost ₹275/litre," Yadav tweeted.

227.title: China to back military-ruled Myanmar 'no matter how situation changes'
227.article_body: China has said that it will back military-ruled Myanmar "no matter how the situation changes". China "has always placed Myanmar in an important position in its neighbourly diplomacy" and wants to "deepen exchanges and cooperation", Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi told his Myanmar counterpart Wunna Maung Lwin on Friday. The Myanmar military overthrew the civilian government in February 2021.

228.title: First audio recordings on Mars reveal 2 speeds of sound; NASA shares clip
228.article_body: The first study of recordings from NASA's Perseverance Mars Rover has shown that the speed of sound is slower on Mars than on Earth, NASA said. It also revealed that sound travels at different speeds for low-pitched and high-pitched noises. "The two sound speeds are an effect of the thin CO2 atmosphere," NASA tweeted, sharing the audio clip.

229.title: Rahul Gandhi visits Puneeth Rajkumar's family in Bengaluru, shares pics
229.article_body:
Congress leader Rahul Gandhi visited late actor Puneeth Rajkumar's house in Bengaluru 
on Thursday and met his family members. Sharing pictures with the late actor's wife and daughter, Rahul tweeted, "Puneeth left unforgettable memories for all Kannadigas at a young age." Notably, the Kannada actor passed away at the age of 46 due to a heart attack in October 2021.

230.title: Things changed for me after my National Award win: Divya Dutta
230.article_body: Actress Divya Dutta opened up about being made the face of the films, saying, "It changed after the National Award I think. People thought I got my due." "It feels nice when...makers say 'not without you for the promotions Divya'," she added. She further said that her image has also undergone a makeover, with everyone taking her seriously.

231.title: Video shows man walking dog from 3rd floor after lockdown in Shanghai
231.article_body: Amid a surge in COVID-19 cases in Shanghai and a subsequent lockdown due to it, a video has surfaced online which showed a man lowering his dog from his third-floor window on a long leash. The clip showed the man walking his dog using the extended leash and lifting the animal back in the same way.

232.title: Bulgaria expels Russian diplomat over spying
232.article_body: Bulgaria has expelled a Russian diplomat over "unregulated intelligence activities". Bulgarian Foreign Ministry on Friday declared the diplomat "persona non grata" and gave him 72 hours to leave the country. The diplomat couldn't be charged in Bulgaria because of his diplomatic immunity. Last month, Bulgaria had expelled 12 Russian diplomats and called back its envoy from Moscow for consultations.

233.title: Escort forces 16-yr-old UK girl to have sex with 17 men in a day to repay debt
233.article_body: A 23-year-old escort has received a suspended sentence in the UK after she made a 16-year-old girl have sex with 17 men in one day to make her repay a loan she took from the escort. The victim was made to have sex with more than 30 men over two weeks for £80 per half-hour, a court was informed.

234.title: 1000 govt staff in MP's Bhopal get show-cause notices for having more than 2 kids
234.article_body: Show-cause notices have been issued to 1,000 government employees and teachers in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, seeking an answer for having more than two children, said AK Modgil, District Education Officer of Vidisha. Modgil said the state government in 2000 specified if any employee had a third child born after January 26, 2001, then they wouldn't be eligible for the job.

235.title: CM Bommai announces ₹5 crore for Karnataka's police welfare fund
235.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced a ₹5 crore grant for the police welfare fund on Saturday. CM Bommai added that the state government is "proud" of the force, which is known for its “conscience, impartiality and humanitarian qualities”. "Crime can be controlled if the police function without any compromise with...criminals," he said while participating in Police Flag Day celebrations.

236.title: Patient bitten by rats in ICU of Telangana govt hospital dies
236.article_body: A 38-year-old man, Srinivas, who was allegedly bitten by rats in the ICU of Warangal's MGM Hospital, died at Hyderabad's NIMS. An official claimed he didn't die of rat bite but from other complications. Srinivas's brother said the incident happened on March 30 and it left him bleeding. Action was initiated against four hospital employees and an inquiry was ordered.

237.title: No unrest in MVA govt, focussed on development: Uddhav Thackeray
237.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has claimed that there is "no internal unrest in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government" on Saturday. "This is MVA, which has its feet firmly on the ground and is working for the state’s development," Thackeray said. He added that the state's coalition government has responded to its critics through its commitment to work for Maharashtra.

238.title: ED attaches assets worth over ₹4 crore of Bihar 'land mafia'
238.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has provisionally attached assets worth ₹4.04 crore of a Bihar-based 'land mafia' under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). The accused and his brothers are engaged in extortion and other criminal activities, ED said. "They are accused in many FIRs...charge-sheets have been filed against them on charges of murder, attempt to murder etc," ED further said.

239.title: Awareness needed, not force: Mandaviya on Population Control Bill
239.article_body: Rejecting the need of population control bill in India, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said that government had successfully used awareness and health campaigns to reduce population growth rather than using "force". The bill which was bought by BJP MP Rakesh Sinha in July 2019 was withdrawn by him on Friday.  The Bill sought to enforce a two-child rule in India.

240.title: NASA conducts last major test before Moon mission launch
240.article_body: NASA has started conducting the "last major test" before the launch of its upcoming Moon mission. It's having a "wet dress rehearsal" for its Space Launch System rocket. It's designed to launch NASA's new crew capsule called Orion, which will carry future astronauts to Moon. It'll launch Orion, without any crew inside, on a four-to six-week-long mission around the Moon.

241.title: Forest official cycles 294 km from Pune to Kolhapur to take charge
241.article_body: Nanasaheb Ladkat, a 59-year-old forest officer in Maharashtra, cycled from Pune to Kolhapur to take charge at his new posting as field director and conservator of Sahyadri Tiger Reserve. Ladkat reportedly cycled 294 kilometres in 17 hours, of which 12 hours were spent pedalling. "The purpose behind this cycling endeavour was to give a message of saving forests," Ladkat said.

242.title: Railway Division in Pune earns record revenue from auto transport
242.article_body: The Railway Division in Pune earned record ₹54.51 crore by transporting vehicles from various automobile manufacturers in the district in the previous financial year. This is a 143% hike in revenues earned from the segment in comparison to the year before last, according to a report. The division had run 301 freight trains last year to transport the vehicles.

243.title: Over 10 illegal farmhouses along Yamuna floodplains demolished
243.article_body: Noida Authority on Friday demolished more than 10 farmhouses along the Yamuna floodplains in Sectors 134 and 135 that had been built illegally. "A drive was carried out to demolish the illegal structures. As per the rules, in floodplain areas, permanent structures cannot be maintained," an official said. The structures were spread across an area of over 25,000 square metres.

244.title: Kejriwal, Mann spin charkha at Guj's Sabarmati Ashram; video surfaces
244.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party has shared a video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann spinning the charkha at the Sabarmati Ashram in Gujarat's Ahmedabad during their visit on Saturday on Twitter. Mahatma Gandhi had stayed in the Ashram. "We consider ourselves blessed that we were born in Gandhiji's country...There is a feeling of peace here," Kejriwal said.

245.title: Tamannaah celebrates Gudi Padwa on sets of 'Babli Bouncer', shares pics
245.article_body: Tamannaah Bhatia celebrated Gudi Padwa on the sets of her upcoming film, 'Babli Bouncer'. The actress, taking to her Instagram Stories on Saturday, shared a few pictures where she can be seen posing with the film's director Madhur Bhandarkar and actors Saurabh Shukla and Supriya Shukla. "Thank you Madhur sir for always adding festivities to our work days," Tamannaah wrote.

246.title: Bungalow of Hanuman set on fire: Tejashwi on Chirag's eviction from Janpath residence
246.article_body: Days after LJP leader Chirag Paswan was evicted from 12 Janpath bungalow which was allotted to Ram Vilas Paswan in New Delhi, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said that BJP has set fire to the bungalow of 'Hanuman'. "Ram Vilas Paswan was standing with the BJP till the last. This is the consequence of supporting the BJP," he added.

247.title: Andhra CM flags off 500 AC vans to transport pregnant women to hospitals
247.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Friday flagged off 500 air-conditioned (AC) vans, named Dr YSR Thalli Bidda Express, to transport pregnant women to hospitals for delivery for free. The vans will also drop the mother and newborn back home once they are discharged from the hospital. "108 ambulance services...104 healthcare services have also been revamped," Reddy said.

248.title: Maybe Umesh's hurt after being picked late having gone unsold twice: Kaif
248.article_body: Talking about Umesh Yadav who is IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder, Mohammad Kaif said Umesh may have felt hurt after being picked late in the mega auction, having gone unsold in the first two rounds. "Umesh may have felt that in the future no IPL team [will] go for him and that's...what may have motivated him," added Kaif.

249.title: Rohit batting with new approach since India's T20 WC loss vs NZ: Parthiv
249.article_body: Parthiv Patel said Team India captain Rohit Sharma has been batting with a new approach having adopted the role of an enforcer, since Team India's defeats against Pakistan and New Zealand in T20 World Cup 2021. "Rohit can accelerate really well but if he starts with an aggressive intent as well, the bowlers are taken aback," added Parthiv.

250.title: He said 'I took a punch from Muhammad Ali': Oscars Producer on Chris' reaction
250.article_body: Academy Awards Producer Will Packer has revealed what happened backstage after Will Smith slapped comedian Chris Rock. Packer recalled, "I said, 'Did he really hit you?' And he looked at me and he goes, 'I just took a punch from Muhammad Ali'...He was immediately in joke mode, but you could tell that he was very much still in shock."

251.title: China separates COVID-19 positive children from their parents in Shanghai
251.article_body: Authorities in China's Shanghai are separating COVID-19 infected children from their parents and sending them to quarantine centres, amid the city's largest outbreak. One such parent said doctors threatened to leave her infected two-and-a-half-year-old daughter at the hospital if the child wasn't sent to quarantine. Pictures of crying children at a Shanghai health facility went viral in China.

252.title: Who were India's 2011 World Cup-winning squad members and how did they perform?
252.article_body: India's 2011 World Cup-winning squad was led by MS Dhoni, who scored 241 runs in the tournament. Sachin Tendulkar, featuring in his last World Cup, was India's highest run-scorer with 482 runs. Zaheer Khan was India's highest wicket-taker in the tournament with 21 wickets. Yuvraj Singh, who was Player of the Tournament, scored 362 runs and took 15 wickets.

253.title: For ₹1,400 crore, Amazon destroyed a ₹26,000-crore company: Future Retail
253.article_body: Future Retail told the Supreme Court that "for ₹1,400 crore, Amazon has destroyed a ₹26,000-crore company". Future's lawyer was referring to the ₹1,400 crore deal between Amazon and Future Coupons, which Amazon has cited to block the deal between Future and Reliance Retail. "We are hanging by a thread...No one wants to do business with us now," Future's lawyer said.

254.title: Criminal probe ordered after UK ferry firm fired 786 employees on Zoom call
254.article_body: UK's P&O Ferries is under criminal and civil investigation after it fired 786 employees over a Zoom call without notice and replaced them with lower-paid crew. The company's CEO Peter Hebblethwaite "stood before MPs and admitted to breaking the law and his actions must now be scrutinised", UK Transport Secretary Grant Shapps said. Hebblethwaite said unions weren't consulted before layoffs.

255.title: BSF seizes 210 cough syrup bottles from Indo-B'desh border in Meghalaya
255.article_body: Border Security Force (BSF) troops have seized 210 bottles of Phensedyl syrup from India-Bangladesh border in Meghalaya's South Garo hills. According to a statement, the bottles were being smuggled to Bangladesh, where the codeine-based cough syrup is banned. This year, BSF seized over 1,300 bottles of Phensedyl while they were being sent illegally through the international border in Meghalaya.

256.title: TV actors Dheeraj Dhoopar, Vinny Arora expecting their 1st child; share pic
256.article_body: 'Kundali Bhagya' actor Dheeraj Dhoopar and his wife, actress Vinny Arora took to social media to announce that they are expecting their first child. "We're expecting, a tiny miracle August 2022," they wrote in the caption. Several actors, including Kishwer Merchantt, Suyyash Rai and Avika Gor congratulated them in the comments section.

257.title: Congratulations, all the best: PM Modi to Aus ahead of Women's WC final
257.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has extended good wishes and congratulated Australia as they will be playing in Women's World Cup final against defending champions England on Sunday. Notably, six-time champions Australia are on an 11-match unbeaten streak. England and Australia will meet in a World Cup final for first time in 34 years. Match will be played at Hagley Oval, Christchurch.

258.title: Indian startup Pixxel launches its first satellite to space with Musk's SpaceX
258.article_body: Indian space tech startup Pixxel has launched its first satellite to space aboard billionaire Elon Musk-led SpaceX's Transporter-4 mission from Cape Canaveral, US. Called 'Shakuntala', it is the startup's first fully-fledged satellite and hosts one of the highest resolution hyperspectral commercial cameras ever flown to space, Pixxel said. The startup is aiming to build a health monitor for Earth.

259.title: SRK is an amazing actor, he's very passionate about his work: Bobby
259.article_body: Bobby Deol in an interview praised Shah Rukh Khan and his skills as a producer. He said that Shah Rukh is an amazing actor and very passionate about his work. "That's why he started his production house and...I'm so thankful for Red Chillies because they gave me 'Class of 83'...and that was the beginning of my OTT journey," said Bobby.

260.title: Miley Cyrus tests positive for COVID-19, says 'It was worth it'
260.article_body: Singer-actor Miley Cyrus, who was recently on a world tour, has tested positive for COVID-19. "Traveling around the world...meeting hundreds of fans a day...chances of getting Covid are pretty high. I have Covid now but it was definitely worth it," she wrote on Twitter. However, the singer added that she will not be performing at the upcoming Janie's Fund event.

261.title: Aaditya Thackeray inaugurates 'Alternate Fuel Conclave' in Pune
261.article_body: Maharashtra Tourism and Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday inaugurated the 'Alternate Fuel Conclave' in Pune. The conclave, which aims to promote clean mobility, will have an electric vehicle (EV) exhibition and an EV rally on April 3. Many companies, including Tata Motors, are participating in the exhibition to showcase their two-wheelers and cars from the alternate fuel segment.

262.title: Rashmika Mandanna to play female lead in Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Animal'
262.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna is set to play the female lead in Ranbir Kapoor starrer 'Animal'. The makers of the film announced the decision on the occasion of Ugadi and Gudi Padwa on Saturday. Helmed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga, the film will go on floors this summer. 'Animal' will also star Anil Kapoor and Bobby Deol in key roles.

263.title: Don't lie, it's not: Arshad after reporter calls Bachchhan Paandey a 'success'
263.article_body: In a recent media interaction, actor Arshad Warsi spoke about the box office performance of his recently released film 'Bachchhan Paandey'. When a reporter called the film's performance at the box office "a success", Arshad chuckled and said, "Don't lie, it's not a success." Arshad added that it was a good film and it just went through a bad patch.

264.title: Thanks but we'll pass: Russia as Czech govt asks Russian diplomats to quit
264.article_body: Czech Republic's Foreign Ministry appealed to Russian diplomats to quit over Moscow's invasion of Ukraine to avoid being accomplices to the "apocalyptic destruction of its sovereign neighbour". Reacting to it, the Russian Mission in Geneva said, "Thanks for the 'generous offer'...but we'll pass. We've plenty of conscience and already maintain the capacity to recognize US lapdog when we see one."

265.title: ED attaches assets worth ₹4 cr of Punjab ex-SSP in money laundering case
265.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has provisionally attached assets worth ₹4.07 crore of Punjab Police's former Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Surjit Singh Grewal in a money laundering case. He had allegedly incurred excess expenditure above his known lawful sources of income. Grewal had purchased various immovable and movable properties in his and his family members' name, as per ED.

266.title: Forest officials rescue 3 kangaroos in West Bengal; team formed to investigate
266.article_body: Forest officials have rescued three kangaroos in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri. According to officials, at least two of the kangaroos were found with some critical injuries on their bodies and were sent to Bengal Safari park for treatment. "A team has been formed to investigate the matter," said Sanjay Dutta, the Belacoba forest range officer.

267.title: Meat shops ordered to remain shut during Navratri in Ghaziabad
267.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has directed all meat shops to remain shut from April 2-10 in view of Navratri. "It has been directed that cleanliness be maintained in respective zones, in temples, and to ensure meat shops remain closed," the order issued for five zones read. Mayor Asha Sharma said the ban on selling raw meat is enforced only during Navratri.

268.title: I've reached a stage where negativity motivates me: Shehnaaz Gill
268.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill in an interview has stated that she has reached a stage where even negativity motivates her to do better. "I believe in doing right, not hurting anyone and concentrating...on improving myself. Maybe that's what will determine my success in life," the actress added. She was earlier trolled for smiling after her boyfriend actor Sidharth Shukla's demise.

269.title: Kim Kardashian to rebrand 'KKW Fragrance' amid divorce with Kanye West
269.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian announced on Friday that she will be rebranding her 'KKW Fragrance' line. Kim took to her Instagram Stories to inform that the KKW Fragrance website will shut down on May 1 to 'relaunch in the future under a brand new name'. This comes after Kim was declared legally single by a US court.

270.title: 1st time feels like Northeast is part of India's mainstream: Rijiju
270.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju while addressing a conference over the reduction of areas under AFSPA in Manipur, Nagaland and Assam on Saturday, said that for the "first time" it feels like the Northeast is part of India's "mainstream". He also called the decision to withdraw AFSPA "revolutionary", and added that it means that "peace has returned to that area".

271.title: MI to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash, playing XIs announced
271.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 match.  MI are fielding the same playing XI that featured in their defeat against DC. RR have made one change to their playing XI, with Navdeep Saini replacing Nathan Coulter-Nile. RR had won their opening match of IPL 2022 against SRH.

272.title: Nigerian held in Noida for cheating women through matrimony sites
272.article_body: A Nigerian national was arrested in UP's Noida for allegedly cheating women by contacting them through matrimonial sites using fake identities, police said. The accused who came to India on medical visa, has so far, as per Cyber Cell estimates, duped his victims of at least ₹50 crore. The police have also traced a farmhouse he has purchased near Pune.

273.title: Will fulfil commitments on crypto, bank privatisation: FM Sitharaman
273.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that the government will fulfil commitments on issues like bank privatisation and cryptocurrency regulation. Speaking at the CNBC-TV18 India Business Leader Awards event, she added, "These are commitments which we have to fulfil. We will be moving forward, you will get to know when."

274.title: 26-yr-old woman returning from work gang-raped in park by 2 men in Delhi
274.article_body: A 26-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped and thrashed by two men while she was returning from work in Delhi on Tuesday night. The accused initially raped her inside a park and then took her to rented accommodation and perpetrated the crime again, a report stated. Following a complaint, Delhi Police arrested both the accused on charges of abduction and rape.

275.title: Next pandemic could be caused by insect-borne viruses like Zika, dengue: WHO
275.article_body: The next pandemic could be triggered by insect-borne viruses like Zika and dengue, an official of the World Health Organization (WHO) has warned. "We...have some signals that the risk is increasing," said Dr Sylvie Briand, Director of WHO's Global Infectious Hazard Preparedness team. Stressing on preparing for the potential pandemic, the agency said that international action is essential.

276.title: Delhi govt allows private shops to offer discounts up to 25% on liquor MRP
276.article_body: Delhi's Department of Excise has issued an order allowing the private shops in the city to offer discounts up to 25% on MRP of liquor. "However, in overall public interest...government reserves the right to withdraw the discount at any time," the order reads. Earlier, in February, the Delhi government had prohibited discounts and schemes being offered by liquor stores.

277.title: PBKS showed real fight to reduce KKR to 51/4 after scoring 137: Mayank
277.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal said his team's bowlers showed "real fight" to reduce KKR to 51/4, while defending 138 in their IPL 2022 match. Andre Russell, Sam Billings stitched an unbeaten partnership of 90 runs off 47 balls as KKR won by six wickets. Russell scored 70 runs off 31 balls with the knock comprising two fours, eight sixes.

278.title: Don't just think of scoring 200, need to respect the pitch: Kaif on PBKS
278.article_body: Reacting to PBKS being bowled out for 137 in their IPL 2022 match against KKR, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said PBKS need to respect the pitch rather than just thinking of scoring 200 every time. "The fact that Bhanuka Rajapaksa would hit three sixes off three balls and would be so explosive is something...I didn't quite read," added Kaif.

279.title: Experience of winning 2017 Women's World Cup can help us: England captain
279.article_body: England skipper Heather Knight said the team's experience of winning ICC Women's World Cup in 2017 can help her side win the 2022 Women's World Cup final against Australia on Sunday. "It (winning 2017 World Cup) will be really useful for us...knowing that we can deal with that pressure when games are close and things are at stake," said Knight.

280.title: Mumbai taxi driver cheated of ₹38 lakh he arranged by selling brother's home
280.article_body: A taxi driver from Kurla, Irshad Shaikh, was allegedly cheated of ₹38 lakh by a woman, Komal Paranjpe, and her accomplice, Anil Vishnu Sawant. Sawant claimed he needed money to transfer a wine shop licence to his name and assured Shaikh he'd give him ₹50 lakh for the help. Shaikh sold his brother's house and mortgaged ornaments to arrange money.

281.title: JP Morgan drops Apple, Qualcomm from most preferred stocks list
281.article_body: Analysts at JP Morgan have dropped Apple and chipmaker Qualcomm from its list of most preferred stocks over slowing smartphones demand. The firm still rates Apple and Qualcomm "overweight", the equivalent of a "buy" rating. It was earlier reported that Apple is planning to cut the production of iPhone and AirPod due to a demand slowdown.

282.title: New variant of COVID-19 found in UK, WHO issues warning
282.article_body: A new COVID-19 variant has been found in the UK, with the country's Health Security Agency saying it was studying 'XE' - a mutation of the BA.1 and BA.2 Omicron strains, referred to as a "recombinant". The WHO has issued a warning against the 'XE' variant of Omicron, that may be more transmissible than any strain of COVID-19.

283.title: I feared for my life a couple of times while batting with Russell: KKR's Sam Billings
283.article_body: Talking about Andre Russell's match-winning knock of 70*(31) against PBKS, KKR's Sam Billings said, "I had the best seat in the house and, what a performance by the big man." He added, "I was very lucky to be standing where I stood. I feared for my life a couple of times, as we saw, but special, special [knock] for him."

284.title: Video shows 2 drunk men dancing on car roof in Ghaziabad, car owner fined ₹20,000
284.article_body: Ghaziabad Police has fined a car owner ₹20,000 after a video showed two men, who were allegedly drunk, dancing on its roof. "A group of boys, visibly drunk, dancing on the roof of their car on the Delhi-Meerut expressway," a Twitter user wrote. The video shows one of them recording a video of the two men dancing on the roof.

285.title: Kolkata-bound IndiGo flight develops technical snag while taking off, grounded
285.article_body: A Kolkata-bound IndiGo flight was grounded at Ranchi Airport in Jharkhand on Saturday after it developed a technical snag while taking off, officials said. "The air-conditioner of the plane developed a snag and it stopped working," said Vinod Sharma, the airport's director. According to him, alternative arrangements were made for the passengers and the flight was brought back to bay.

286.title: Serbian President waves at imaginary crowd at an event, video surfaces
286.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that showed Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic waving at an imaginary crowd along with Hungarian PM Viktor Orban after Vucic inaugurated a section of a railway line. The clip showed Vucic waving at the railway platform, which had no crowd, while Orban is seated next to him. Orban, however, stopped waving after a point.

287.title: Future Enterprises misses due date to repay ₹2,835 crore to lenders
287.article_body: Future Enterprises has informed the stock exchanges that it has missed the due date of March 31, 2022, to repay ₹2,835.65 crore to various consortium banks and lenders. On Friday, Future Retail (FRL) said it had defaulted on a loan repayment of ₹5,322.32 crore and also failed to raise ₹3,900 crore. FRL cited ongoing litigations with Amazon as the reason.

288.title: US commits $300 million more in security aid to Ukraine
288.article_body: The US has said it will provide an additional $300 million in security assistance to bolster Ukraine's capacity to defend itself. The package includes laser-guided rocket systems, tactical drones, Humvees, night vision goggles, machine guns, and medical supplies. "The US has now committed...over $1.6 billion in security assistance since Russia's unprovoked, premeditated invasion," Pentagon said.

289.title: Heat wave warning issued for 10 states/UTs over 5 days, list released
289.article_body: The IMD issued heat wave warning for 10 states/UTs over five days. Heat wave conditions are likely to prevail over Haryana and Chhattisgarh on April 2. They are likely to prevail over Himachal Pradesh, Jammu, Maharashtra and Gujarat on April 2 and 3. Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh & Madhya Pradesh may witness heat wave conditions during next five days.

290.title: PM 'robbing' Punjab of its rights: CM Bhagwant Mann
290.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann accused PM Narendra Modi of "robbing" the state of its rights amid a political row over Home Minister Amit Shah's recent announcement that central service rules will apply to employees of Chandigarh. "The PM says 'sabka saath sabka vikas'. Where is our 'saath'? Neither you take our 'saath' nor give the same to us," Mann said.

291.title: Australia trade pact is India's 1st agreement with a developed country after 10 yrs
291.article_body: After India signed an economic cooperation and trade agreement with Australia, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal referred to it as a "historic day" for India. "It is the first agreement with a developed country after a decade," Goyal said. The agreement will take bilateral trade from the existing $27.5 billion to $45-50 billion in over five years, the minister added.

292.title: Which sectors will benefit from India's historic trade pact with Australia?
292.article_body: Several labour-intensive sectors will get duty-free access to markets in Australia under the historic economic cooperation and trade agreement signed by India and Australia. These include textiles and apparel, leather and footwear, select agricultural and fish products, gems and jewellery, pharma and machinery and electrical goods sectors. Overall, 96% of Indian goods will get duty-free access.

293.title: 25 Rohingyas owing allegiance to Tablighi Jamaat detained in J&K
293.article_body: At least 25 Rohingya men who owe allegiance to the Tablighi Jamaat have been detained by the police in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban, officials said. The Rohingyas were later shifted to a holding centre inside a jail in Hiranagar on Friday, the officials added. The men had been picked up from two mosques in Ramban on March 30, police said.

294.title: Open borders between India, Nepal should not be misused: PM Modi
294.article_body: The open borders between India and Nepal should not be misused, PM Narendra Modi said on Saturday at an event in Delhi. Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba, who is on a visit to India, was also present at the event. "We also stressed on maintaining close cooperation between our defence and security agencies," PM Modi added.

295.title: BharatPe board aiming for IPO in 18-24 months: Chairman
295.article_body: BharatPe Chairman Rajnish Kumar has said the firm's board, founders and management want to take it public in the next 18-24 months. He added the board will also be expanded with more independent directors in future. He also revealed that there have been investor queries for funding and despite the negative press, BharatPe's valuation should be higher than $2.8 billion.

296.title: Waiting to book case if you're wheeling: B'luru police as it arrests person
296.article_body: Bengaluru's DCP Traffic East on Friday tweeted that it has filed a case against a person and seized his two-wheeler for allegedly wheeling on Bettadasanapura Road in Electronic City. "If you are wheeling, we are waiting to book [a] case against you," the traffic police said. The traffic police also shared a picture of the accused and the seized vehicle.

297.title: Lady Gaga, Justin Bieber to perform at Grammys 2022
297.article_body: Lady Gaga and Justin Bieber will perform at the 64th Grammy Awards in Las Vegas on April 3. The announcement of Gaga and Bieber's performances comes after the rock band Foo Fighters cancelled their performance at the Grammys this year following the demise of their drummer Taylor Hawkins. Gaga and Bieber join a lineup that includes BTS and Billie Eilish.

298.title: Oil depot attack to further stretch Russian logistics: UK
298.article_body: The destruction of several oil tanks at a depot in Russia's Belgorod city will "likely add short-term strain to Russia's already stretched logistics chains", UK Defence Ministry said. Russia had accused Ukraine of carrying out the airstrike at the oil depot on Friday. "Supplies to Russian forces encircling [Ukraine's] Kharkiv [60 km from Belgorod] may be particularly affected," it added.

299.title: Entire India will be happy seeing Hardik Pandya bowl 4 overs: Shastri
299.article_body: Ravi Shastri said entire India will be happy seeing Hardik Pandya bowl four overs, adding that India will straightaway become potential T20 World Cup 2022 winners if Hardik finds his mojo. "Hardik is hungry," stated Shastri. Discussing the IPL 2022 match between MI and RR, Shastri said Jos Buttler will "hammer" the MI bowlers if he survives for six overs.

300.title: Political executive will change, you are permanent: CJI Ramana to CBI
300.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana said that political executive will change with time but the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI), as an institution, is permanent. "Be impermeable...be independent," CJI told CBI. "There is an immediate requirement for the creation of an independent umbrella institution...to bring various agencies like CBI, SFIO, ED, etc under one roof," he stated.

301.title: Anil wishes sister-in-law & Miss India 1969 Kavita Singh on b'day, pens note
301.article_body: Anil Kapoor took to Instagram on Friday to wish his sister-in-law Kavita Singh on her 70th birthday. Kavita is Sunita Kapoor's elder sister and was crowned Miss India in 1969. Sharing some old pictures of Kavita, Anil wrote, "Happy 70th Birthday Kavita! We're all so proud of you always! Lucky to have a friend and sister in law like you."

302.title: SAI releases over ₹7 crore allowance to 2,509 Khelo India athletes
302.article_body: The Sports Authority of India (SAI) has released ₹7.22 crore allowance to 2,509 Khelo India athletes across 21 disciplines, including para-sports, for the months of January to March. The amount includes an out-of-pocket allowance of ₹1.20 lakh for each residential athlete. The majority part of the budget is allocated for athletes' lodging, food and education at the academy, SAI said.

303.title: 40,000 tonnes of diesel from India reach Sri Lanka as it declares emergency
303.article_body: A ship carrying 40,000 tonnes of diesel under a $1-billion credit line by India has reached Sri Lanka amid its economic crisis. On Friday night, the country's government declared a state of emergency after protests over the crisis turned violent. Earlier, Indian Oil's Lankan subsidiary supplied 6,000 MT of fuel to the Ceylon Electricity Board to generate electricity.

304.title: Ukraine raises $600,000 from 'Museum of War' NFTs on Russian invasion
304.article_body: The Ukrainian government has raised more than $600,000 from its NFT collection, Meta History: Museum of War', showing a timeline of the Russian invasion. The government sold 1,282 artworks on its first day of sales, raising 190 Ether cryptocurrency tokens. The Ukrainian government has already raised about $70.2 million in crypto donations, its official website showed.

305.title: Woman techie arrested for selling cannabis to IT employees, youths in Hyd
305.article_body: A woman techie was arrested for allegedly supplying cannabis to some IT employees and youths in Hyderabad. Police said she, along with her husband and two others, were selling cannabis to customers on March 12 when police apprehended two youths with 1.2 kg cannabis. The couple, who had managed to escape, were arrested after police received information from the youths.

306.title: I suffered from sleep apnea, it got more intense with time and it is dangerous: Badshah
306.article_body: Rapper Badshah, in an episode of Shilpa Shetty's fitness chat show 'Shape of You', revealed that he suffered from sleep apnea. "It got more intense with time and it is dangerous," he added, stating that now he doesn't suffer from it. "I have been through clinical depression, I have been through severe anxiety disorder," he further said.

307.title: I don't discuss my orders: Zelenskyy on Russian allegations of fuel depot attack
307.article_body: Responding to Russian accusations that Ukraine attacked a fuel depot inside Russia's Belgorod, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "I'm sorry I don't discuss any of my orders." "There are things which I only share with military armed forces of Ukraine," Zelenskyy added. Russian Ministry of Defense stated that two Ukrainian Mi-24 helicopters carried out an airstrike on the depot.

308.title: SRH lodge protest against Kane Williamson's dismissal
308.article_body: SRH have lodged a protest with the BCCI against their captain Kane Williamson's dismissal against RR in their first IPL 2022 match, claiming that the catch was not clean. RR's Devdutt Padikkal had managed to scoop his fingers under the ball to hold onto a low catch and the third umpire had ruled that the catch was clean.

309.title: I need to work hard on my game: KKR pacer Umesh Yadav
309.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders' fast bowler Umesh Yadav believes that he needs to "work hard" on his skills despite picking up four wickets against the Punjab Kings on Friday. "I need to work hard. Getting older and when you know you play just one format, I look to bowl as much as possible," Yadav said.

310.title: Lemon price rises to ₹200 per kg in Gujarat due to tight supply
310.article_body: The prices of lemons have surged to ₹200 per kg in Gujarat's Rajkot due to a shortage in supplies and a rise in demand. Earlier, the lemons were being sold at ₹50-60 per kg, as per ANI report. "This increase in price is affecting our kitchen budget. We don't know when will the prices go down," a customer told ANI.

311.title: Russian forces are noticeably moving out of northern Ukraine: Zelenskyy
311.article_body: Russian troops are "slowly but noticeably" moving out of the north of Ukraine, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. He urged residents to remain cautious amid troop withdrawal. Zelenskyy also warned that the situation in the country's east is "extremely difficult" with Russia gathering its forces and "preparing for new powerful blows". Ukraine is preparing an "active" defence, he added.

312.title: Exempt Ayodhya temples from water, house tax: UP CM Yogi Adityanath
312.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday asked Ayodhya Municipal Corporation to stop the collection of house and water taxes from temples, maths and dharamshalas. He instead suggested  taking 'token money' from such religious institutions. "He asked officials to prepare a plan in this regard and submit it to the urban development department," a government spokesperson added.

313.title: Too much pressure on Pollard, even the opponents know that: Shastri
313.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said there is "too much" pressure on MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard in the absence of Hardik Pandya, Krunal Pandya and Suryakumar Yadav. "Even the opponents know that Pollard is under pressure. His early wicket can make a difference of 20-30 runs," added Shastri. Pollard was dismissed for three in MI's IPL 2022 opener against DC.

314.title: Police seize truck carrying 197 kg of marijuana in Pune, 3 booked
314.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad police have seized 197 kilograms of marijuana from a truck in Pune and have booked three people including the driver who has been arrested. Police intercepted the truck on the Chakan–Shikrapur road and seized items worth ₹63.34 lakh, police said. The case was lodged under sections of the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

315.title: Hyd SHE Teams in-charge reviews performance for first quarter of 2022
315.article_body: AR Srinivas, Additional Commissioner of Police (Crimes), on Friday reviewed the performance of Hyderabad SHE Teams for the first quarter of the year 2022. Srinivas, who is also in-charge of SHE Teams, rewarded officials for their sustained efforts in making Hyderabad a safe city for women. He further promised to provide the teams with more advanced logistics in future.

316.title: Pune court to fine woman each time father is denied access to son
316.article_body: A family court in Pune has directed a woman to allow the father access to their 11-year-old son or she will be fined ₹5,000 for each missed access. The court said that if the woman violates the order in the next six months, the son's custody will be given to the father. The couple has been living separately since 2008.

317.title: Punjab govt is 'baccha party': Anil Vij on Punjab seeking transfer of Chandigarh
317.article_body: Reacting to AAP-led Punjab government's resolution seeking the immediate transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana Minister Anil Vij, said, "Punjab government is 'baccha party'. They don't have complete knowledge of issues." "Chandigarh isn't the only issue but there are many other issues linked to it," he added. "They didn't speak anything about issues like SYL, Hindi speaking areas," he added.

318.title: Bombay HC grants bail to 10 accused, rejects pleas of 8 in Palghar lynching case
318.article_body: Bombay High Court has granted bail to 10 accused and rejected the pleas of eight others in connection with 2020 Palghar mob lynching case. The applicants cannot be held guilty without any sufficient evidence, HC said. A mob lynched two sadhus and their driver in April 2020 in Maharashtra's Palghar amid rumours that thieves were roaming around during COVID-19 lockdown.

319.title: Trust yourself when no one does: Amit Mishra on Umesh holding Purple Cap
319.article_body: Reacting to Umesh Yadav being IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder, ex-DC spinner Amit Mishra tweeted, "Trust yourself even when no one else does." Umesh has picked eight wickets in three matches at an economy rate of 4.91. "Umesh played...two matches in [the] last two IPL seasons...Warms my heart to see him do well," read a tweet from Wasim Jaffer.

320.title: Teacher gets 5-year jail term for sexually abusing 13-year-old boy in Mumbai
320.article_body: A 52-year-old sports teacher was convicted and sentenced to five years in jail for sexually abusing a 13-year-old boy on the pretext of giving him a medal and a certificate for participating in a competition. The boy informed a court in Mumbai that the accused pretended to show him and his friend a magic trick and then touched him inappropriately.

321.title: BMC's property tax collection increases by ₹700 crore in 2021-22
321.article_body: The property tax collected by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) increased by ₹700 crore in 2021-22 as compared to the last year. The BMC collected ₹5,792 crore from property tax in 2021-22, which is the highest in its history, officials added. According to the civic body, three out of the city's 24 wards collected 30% more tax than the previous year.

322.title: Langur cutouts to be placed in parts of UP's Meerut to scare away monkeys
322.article_body: The Forest Department in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut has decided to place cutouts of langurs in some areas to scare away monkeys. "Increasing monkey presence is a concern in northern India," Meerut DFO said, adding that the move is aimed at providing relief to people. Residents had earlier reportedly appealed to the district administration to find a solution to the problem.

323.title: Biden nominates 2 Indian-Americans to key administrative positions
323.article_body: US President Joe Biden has nominated two Indian-Americans to key administrative positions. Vinay Singh has been nominated as Chief Financial Officer, Department of Housing and Urban Development, while Kalpana Kotagal is the nominee for Commissioner on the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission. Singh had also served in the Obama-Biden administration as a Deputy Assistant Secretary (US Field).

324.title: Class 10 girl beaten for hours for filing rape complaint in Odisha
324.article_body: Eight people, including five women, have been arrested for allegedly beating a Class 10 girl for hours at a kangaroo court in Odisha's Nayagarh for filing a case accusing a 21-year-old man of raping her. The girl's family claimed that they were advised to not file a case earlier. The girl was also tied to an electric pole, police said.

325.title: My PAN card misused, small loan of ₹2,500 taken on my name: Rajkummar Rao calls out fraud
325.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao took to Twitter to call out fraud, claiming that his PAN card was misused and a small loan of ₹2,500 was taken on his name. He added that his CIBIL score has been affected due to it. He further wrote, "@CIBIL_Official, please rectify the same and do take precautionary steps against this."

326.title: Irfan Pathan pranks Suresh Raina on live TV over Preity Zinta comment
326.article_body: Irfan Pathan pranked Suresh Raina on April Fool's Day during pre-IPL match show. Irfan was talking about PBKS when Raina remarked, "Irfan...played for PBKS...for three years...Preity Zinta is their owner." Seemingly angry, Irfan said, "This isn't right...The way you brought in female angle" and left the frame. Irfan revealed it was a prank when Raina went to bring him back.

327.title: BharatPe has appointed Alvarez & Marsal exec as interim CFO: Chairman
327.article_body: BharatPe has appointed an executive from Alvarez & Marsal as its interim CFO, Chairman Rajnish Kumar said. The firm is in search of a permanent CFO and Kumar said it is in the "advanced stages" to appoint one. Kumar added that the board, founders, and management are exploring taking the firm public in the next 18-24 months.

328.title: Twitter tweets 'we're working on an edit button'; users say it's April Fools' Day
328.article_body: On April 1, Twitter tweeted on its official account that it was "working on an edit button" after which several users flagged that it was April Fools' Day. When asked if the tweet was a joke, Twitter told Reuters, "We cannot confirm or deny but we may edit our statement later." "Prove it by editing this tweet," a user wrote.

329.title: 'Stop bullying India' poster found outside US Embassy in Delhi; FIR registered
329.article_body: Delhi Police have registered an FIR against an unknown person after a poster asking US to "stop bullying India" was found stuck on a board outside the US Embassy. "Reliable [US President] Biden administration, stop bullying India. We don't need you. US needs India against China," the poster read. Police is making use of technical surveillance to trace the person.

330.title: Chandigarh is and will remain joint capital of Punjab, Haryana: CM Khattar
330.article_body: After Punjab government's resolution seeking transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said Chandigarh is the joint capital of the two states and will remain so. "Punjab government's one-sided resolution has no meaning," he added. "This isn't only a subject of Punjab but also of Haryana. Even the people of Himachal Pradesh claim their share," Khattar said.

331.title: 3 arrested for shooting at sarpanch over business rivalry in Gurugram
331.article_body: Three men were arrested for their alleged involvement in the shooting of a 50-year-old sarpanch in Gurugram's Babupur over business rivalry, police said. The main accused had taken a loan of ₹10 lakh from the sarpanch's nephew, police added. On being asked to return the loan, the accused demanded a share in the nephew's water supply and construction business.

332.title: 'Pulp Fiction' stars Samuel, Uma Thurman to reunite for 'The Kill Room'
332.article_body: Samuel L. Jackson and Uma Thurman, who shared screen space in 'Pulp Fiction', are teaming up again for a new comic crime thriller titled 'The Kill Room'. According to The Hollywood Reporter, it'll be directed by Nicol Paone, who helmed the comedy-drama 'Friendsgiving'. "Getting to make 'The Kill Room' with Uma and Samuel is beyond my wildest dreams," Paone said.

333.title: Performance of Lalit, Axar has given DC a huge boost: Ajit Agarkar
333.article_body: Delhi Capitals' assistant coach Ajit Agarkar has acknowledged that their IPL franchise got a "huge boost" from Lalit Yadav and Axar Patel's match-winning partnership against Mumbai Indians last week. "When you win from difficult situations, it always gives you... much more confidence as a team," Agarkar said. He also added that DC have a great depth in its batting order.

334.title: China denies deliberately circumventing Russia sanctions
334.article_body: China said it's not deliberately circumventing sanctions on Russia, a day after EU leaders warned Beijing against doing so. Wang Lutong, a Chinese Foreign Ministry official, said Beijing was helping the global economy through continued trade with Russia. "China is not a related party to Ukraine crisis. We don't think our normal trade with any...country should be affected," Lutong said.

335.title: BJP MP demands renaming UP's Farrukhabad as Panchal Nagar, writes to CM
335.article_body: BJP MP from Farrukhabad, Mukesh Rajput, has written to UP CM Yogi Adityanath demanding renaming Farrukhabad as Panchal Nagar. “Farrukhabad has links to the Mahabharata era. The capital of king Drupada used to be here... known as Panchala area,” he wrote. However, Rajput denied the request being based on religious lines and claimed it's to only "revive ancient Indian culture".

336.title: Uber raises cab fares by 15% in Mumbai as fuel prices go up
336.article_body: App-based taxi firm Uber has raised fares by 15% for travel in Mumbai to offset the impact of rising fuel prices, the company said. Fuel prices have been hiked for the 10th time in 12 days across the country on Saturday. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹117.57/litre from ₹116.72/litre while diesel price has increased to ₹101.79/litre from ₹100.94/litre.

337.title: Matua community pilgrims claim their bus attacked in Bengal, block rail track
337.article_body: Some members of the Matua community blocked the track at Habra railway station in protest against an alleged attack on a bus carrying the pilgrims to 'Baruni Mela' in West Bengal. Four persons have been arrested in the incident so far. Police claimed the pilgrims got into an altercation with another bus' passengers following a collision between the two vehicles.

338.title: IIT-Delhi gifted indoor sports complex by alumnus Saurabh Mittal
338.article_body: IIT-Delhi inaugurated its three-storey air-conditioned indoor sports complex on Friday. The complex will be called the ‘Mittal Sports Complex’ since it has been installed due to the financial aid of ₹10 crore given by the institute's alumnus and co-founder of the Indiabulls group Saurabh Mittal. The complex has several facilities including badminton courts, squash courts and a conference room.

339.title: Microsoft hires ex-Seattle police chief as global security risk ops exec
339.article_body: Microsoft has hired former Seattle police chief Carmen Best as Director of global security risk operations. Best became the first Black woman to serve as chief in 2018 but left in 2020. She will be in charge of Microsoft's global virtual security operations team, intelligence, executive threat intel, special asset security and event security, among other things.

340.title: UP Police raids BSP leader Haji Yakoob Qureshi's meat factory in Meerut
340.article_body: UP Police raided a meat factory in Meerut owned by BSP leader and former minister, Haji Yakoob Qureshi, officials said. "A case has been registered against 14 people...10 of them have been arrested. We found that it was running illegally," Meerut SSP Prabhakar Chaudhary said. "Action will be taken against the culprits under the Gangster Act," he added.

341.title: Neighbours allegedly beat Muslim man for putting up BJP flag in UP
341.article_body: A case has been filed after a Muslim man from Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur alleged that his neighbours thrashed him for putting up a BJP flag at his house. The man claimed that his neighbours were angered after a BJP MLA had come there and garlanded him. Earlier, a Muslim man was allegedly killed for celebrating BJP's win in state polls.

342.title: 3 criminals killed in police encounter in Assam's Goalpara
342.article_body: Three criminals were allegedly killed in police encounter while trying to escape in a truck in Assam's Goalpara district on Friday. "Acting on a tip-off, we stopped a vehicle but they tried to run away and opened fire on us," ASP Mrinal Deka said. The criminals were badly injured in the incident and were declared dead at hospital, he added.

343.title: No fine to be imposed for not wearing face masks in Delhi
343.article_body: In view of the declining COVID-19 positivity rate, the Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) announced on Friday that the fine imposed for not wearing masks in public places will now be scrapped. An order issued by the DDMA, however, advised people to continue wearing masks in public places in order to avoid contracting COVID-19.

344.title: Doctors wanted to amputate my leg after I smashed my knee during 'Force 2': John
344.article_body: Actor John Abraham has revealed that doctors wanted to amputate his leg after he smashed his knee during 'Force 2'. "I underwent three surgeries. I had gangrene in my right leg and the doctors wanted to amputate my leg," he said. He added that his surgeon Dr Rajesh Maniar from Mumbai saved his knee.

345.title: 3 journalists among 34 arrested over Uttar Pradesh Board question paper leak
345.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police on Friday arrested 10 more people, including three journalists and parents and guardians of students, in connection with the leak of Class 12 UP Board English paper in Ballia. So far, 34 persons have been arrested in the case. At least two of the journalists have alleged that they've been framed for reporting on the paper leak.

346.title: Umesh was among the last to get picked, now most effective: Ajay Jadeja
346.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder Umesh Yadav was among the last players to get picked in mega auction, but is now the most effective. "Many players in the IPL end up getting typecast," added Ajay. Umesh has picked eight wickets in three matches so far, after recording figures of 4/23 against PBKS.

347.title: Anyone can be a mystery bowler by bowling the perfect length: Rashid
347.article_body: GT spinner Rashid Khan said anyone can become a mystery bowler by bowling the deliveries at the perfect length time and again. "If you have good control over your skills, the element of mystery doesn't matter," added Rashid. "My length...makes me different from other leg-spinners," stated Rashid. "I am a spin-fast bowler because of [my] pace," said Rashid.

348.title: PM Modi greets people on Hindu New Year, Chaitra Navaratri
348.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday greeted people on the beginning of Hindu New Year, Chaitra Navaratri, and offered his best wishes to various regions and communities celebrating their new year as per the traditional Hindu calendar. "Happy New Year to all of you. May Vikram Samvat 2079 bring new enthusiasm and new zeal in everyone’s life," PM Modi tweeted.

349.title: India & Australia sign trade pact, 96% Indian goods to get duty free access
349.article_body: India and Australia on Saturday signed the Economic Cooperation & Trade Agreement to boost economic ties. Under the pact, over 96% Indian goods will get duty free access to Australia's market. "This is truly a watershed moment," PM Narendra Modi said.
