Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said the agreement will take bilateral trade to $45-50 billion in the next five years.

350.title: Rishi Kapoor was not happy with the 2nd half of 'Sharmaji...': Director
350.article_body: Hitesh Bhatia, director of Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen', has revealed that Rishi was not "very happy" with the second half of the film. "He...had a lot of input. He kept calling us after every three-four days, with ideas to discuss," he added. "It took us another two or three months to finish...draft...So he was quite involved," said Hitesh.

351.title: Delhi shuts 1,000 jab centres, terminates services of vaccinators
351.article_body: The Delhi government has shut over 1,000 jab centres that were operational in schools, non-health facilities as majority of its adult, teenage population have received their first dose of COVID vaccination. The services of around 1,900 contractual vaccinators, nurses and data-entry operators were also terminated. On Friday, Delhi conducted its vaccination drive only from 488 centres, data showed.

352.title: B'luru petrol prices reach ₹108.14/litre after 10th hike in 12 days
352.article_body: After fuel prices were hiked for the 10th time in 12 days, the price of petrol has reached ₹108.14/litre in Bengaluru, while that of diesel has reached ₹92.05/litre, according to the Indian Express. In total, the price of petrol has gone up by ₹7.20/litre. Earlier, Karnataka Congress leaders had staged a protest against the hike in fuel prices in Bengaluru.

353.title: Mid-day meal scheme to be renamed after Dr Shivakumara Swamiji: K'taka CM
353.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday announced that the mid-day meal scheme in the state will be renamed after Dr Shivakumara Swamiji of Siddaganga Mutt in the Tumakuru district. The announcement came on the occasion of Swamiji's 115th birth anniversary. BJP's state vice-president and son of former CM BS Yediyurappa, BY Vijayendra had earlier proposed to rename the scheme.

354.title: KKR were stunned by PBKS' approach after losing wicket in 1st over: Shreyas
354.article_body: Discussing KKR's win in the IPL 2022 match against PBKS, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer admitted his team was stunned by PBKS' approach after losing a wicket in the first over. Bhanuka Rajapaksa and Shikhar Dhawan stitched a partnership of 41 runs off 17 balls, after the dismissal of Mayank Agarwal for 1. PBKS finished the powerplay on 62/3.

355.title: Taiwan shuts 39 schools amid rising COVID-19 cases
355.article_body: Taiwan on Friday shut 39 schools in 10 counties amid rising COVID-19 cases. Reportedly, many teachers and students have been infected with the virus. According to the Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC), Taiwan on Friday reported 104 domestic COVID-19 cases, most in 281 days. So far, Taiwan has reported more than 23,620 COVID-19 cases and over 850 coronavirus-related deaths.

356.title: Indian Post launches Maha's 1st e-vehicles batch for home delivery
356.article_body: The Pune office of the Indian Post on Friday launched Maharashtra's first batch of e-vehicles for doorstep parcel delivery. "If the pilot proves to be successful, we'll look at extending it to many other post offices in the city," Pune Region Post Master General G Madhumita Das said. She added that the initiative is for "leveraging the consequential environmental benefits".

357.title: Pant can overcome IPL strike rate issue in a single innings: Shastri
357.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant who has recorded strike rates of 128.52 and 113.95 in the previous two editions of IPL, Ravi Shastri said Pant can overcome the issue over his strike rate in a single innings. "The thing I like about Pant the most is that his batting...captaincy isn't the same. As a captain, he's...a lot more composed," added Shastri.

358.title: When Bezos was in space, we were getting signs to unionise: Ex-Amazon worker
358.article_body:
Former Amazon worker Christian Smalls said he would like to thank Jeff Bezos for going to space, after the Amazon workers at the New York warehouse voted to form Amazon's first US union.
"When he was up there we were signing people up. We were out here getting signatures," Smalls said. Bezos went to space in July last year.

359.title: Tharoor moves Private Member's Bill to repeal UAPA, calls Act a 'tool of abuse'
359.article_body: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor came up with a Private Member’s Bill to repeal the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act in Lok Sabha on Friday. "It’s (UAPA) a tool of abuse in which 66% of cases involve no violence, 56% are detained w/no charge-sheet for two years & conviction rate since 2014 is an abysmal 2.4%," Tharoor said in a tweet.

360.title: Video of Carrey forcibly kissing Alicia resurfaces after his comment on Will Smith
360.article_body: A video of actor-comedian Jim Carrey forcibly kissing actress Alicia Silverstone on stage at an award ceremony in 1997 resurfaced after his comments on Will Smith-Chris Rock slap controversy. Carrey criticised Will Smith, saying he would've sued him for $200 million. "After seeing...clip of Carrey assaulting Silverstone, it was best if he had kept his mouth shut," a user tweeted.

361.title: India records its warmest March in 122 years
361.article_body: India, on average, recorded its warmest March days in 122 years with the maximum temperature across the country clocking in at 1.86°C above normal, an analysis by the India Meteorological Department (IMD) showed. The average maximum, minimum and mean temperatures for the country as a whole during March 2022 were 33.10°C, 20.24°C and 26.67°C, respectively.

362.title: Petrol gets costlier by ₹7.20 per litre with 10 hikes in 12 days
362.article_body: Petrol and diesel have become costlier by ₹7.20 per litre each as the prices have been hiked 10 times since a four-and-half-month long pause in rate revision ended on March 22. Petrol price neared ₹103 per litre in Delhi on Saturday and crossed ₹117 in Mumbai after a hike of over 80 paise. Diesel price hit ₹93.87/litre in Delhi.

363.title: Man jailed for threatening to behead US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi
363.article_body: A 60-year-old man has been sentenced to 18 months in prison for making death threats to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, and Illinois prosecutor Kim Foxx. Paul Vernon Hoeffer had pleaded guilty in January to threatening to cut Pelosi's head off "jihadist style" and calling Ocasio-Cortez's office to tell her he would "rip her head off".

364.title: Mike Tyson completes dubbing for Deverakonda's 'Liger', says 'I'm grateful'
364.article_body: Former American boxer Mike Tyson has finished dubbing for the pan-India movie 'Liger', which features Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday in the lead roles. Dharma Productions, taking to Instagram on Friday, shared the news along with a video message from Tyson. "Thank you very much for being kind to me. I'm very grateful," he said. It's directed by Puri Jagannadh.

365.title: I'd love to but industry lacks unity: John on working in all-star action film
365.article_body: Actor John Abraham said in an interview that he would love to do an all-star action film, adding, "But I think as an industry where we lack is unity." "That's something you've got to learn from the South. They are cohesive, and that's fantastic," he added. John will next be seen in 'Ek Villain Returns', which also stars Arjun Kapoor.

366.title: Bihar electricity dept staffer rides horse to work amid fuel price hike
366.article_body: A Bihar electricity department staffer from Sheohar has been riding a horse from one village to another to collect electricity bills amid a rise in fuel prices. The staffer claimed that he was spending nearly ₹200/day on petrol to collect the bills using his motorcycle. Petrol and diesel prices were increased for the 10th time in 12 days on Saturday.

367.title: Habitual house burglar held in Hyd, valuables worth ₹1.3 cr recovered
367.article_body: A 50-year-old habitual house burglar was arrested by Vanasthalipuram police in Hyderabad on Friday. Police also recovered valuables worth ₹1.3 crore, including 230 tolas of gold, 10 kg silver and over ₹15,000 cash, from the accused. According to police, the accused, identified as Muchu Ambedkar, lives near Indira Park. He has been committing burglaries for past 30 years, police added.

368.title: Pay farmers within 72 hours of crop procurement: UP CM to officials
368.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday directed officials to pay the farmers within 72 hours of crop procurement. "Officers should make all the necessary arrangements for the procurement of wheat in their respective districts so that farmers don't face any problem," Adityanath said. Notably, the Centre has fixed the minimum support price (MSP) of wheat at ₹2,015 per quintal.

369.title: Police lathicharge villagers protesting mining project in Chhattisgarh, 25 injured
369.article_body: A clash broke out between police and local residents after the latter tried to enter the collector's office to submit a 20-point memorandum over the Rowghat iron ore mining project in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur. Protesters claimed that 25 people were injured after police lathicharged them. According to the villagers, mining will destroy minor forest produce, which is their source of livelihood.

370.title: BMC medical officer duped of ₹1.75 lakh after investing in crypto based app
370.article_body: A 25-year-old BMC medical officer was cheated of ₹1.75 lakh after she invested in a cryptocurrency based app. According to police, the woman, who had learnt about the app from a relative, initially received returns on her investment after which she invested larger sums. However, she stopped receiving payment in the past few weeks following which she contacted the police.

371.title: Class 10 student jumps to death over sexual harassment by headmaster in Odisha
371.article_body: A Class 10 girl student jumped to death from the roof of a hostel building over alleged sexual harassment by the school's headmaster in Odisha's Sundargarh, police said. The headmaster and school's warden were detained on Friday, police added. Several other students also alleged sexual harassment by the headmaster, the police officials, who spoke to other girls, said.

372.title: Truck driver kills self for ₹30,000 in Bengaluru
372.article_body: A 35-year-old truck driver, identified as Kiran Kumar, killed himself in Bengaluru's Sanjeevini Nagar after allegedly not receiving his salary from private logistics firm he used to work for. Kumar had sent a video to three of his colleagues demanding ₹30,000 to be paid to him within 30 minutes and warned of ending his life if he was not paid.

373.title: Lawsuit against Airbnb over host spying on couple goes to arbitrator
373.article_body: A US judge has said that the lawsuit brought against Airbnb by a couple, that was allegedly videotaped by a host, must go to an arbitrator. The couple had sued both the host and Airbnb. As per the Airbnb agreement, the couple is bound to have an arbitrator decide whether the dispute can be litigated in court, the judge said.

374.title: SC rejects plea by Maharashtra govt for SIT probe against Anil Deshmukh
374.article_body: Supreme Court has rejected the Maharashtra government's plea demanding a court-monitored Special Investigation Team (SIT) probe against former state Home Minister Anil Deshmukh. CBI's investigation can be biased as former Maharashtra Police chief Subodh Kumar Jaiswal is now the investigating agency's chief, the plea claimed. Deshmukh is being investigated in alleged corruption and bribery cases.

375.title: The ball takes a life of its own when you hit it: Shah Rukh Khan to Andre Russell
375.article_body: After Andre Russell scored 70*(31) to help KKR beat PBKS, KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "Welcome back my friend...So long since saw the ball fly so high!" Shah Rukh added, "It takes a life of its own when you hit it...man!" Russell slammed eight sixes against PBKS, the most by a batter in an IPL 2022 match so far.

376.title: Infosys to shut Russia office amid pressure over Ukraine war: Reports
376.article_body: Indian IT major Infosys is closing its office in Russia after facing pressure to stop operating amid Russia's war with Ukraine, reports said. Earlier, UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak faced questions over his wife Akshata's stake in Infosys, which was co-founded by her father Narayana Murthy. Infosys is trying to find replacement roles abroad for Moscow employees, BBC reported.

377.title: 36-year-old woman in Gujarat moves HC seeking 'No Religion, No Caste' certificate
377.article_body: A 36-year old woman from Surat has moved Gujarat High Court with a petition seeking the court's directions to the authorities to issue her a 'No Religion, No Caste' certificate. Kajal Manjula, who originally belongs to Rajgor Brahmin community, stated that she has had to face "so many troubles in her life due to discriminatory caste system".

378.title: Kabir Singh was a modern aggressive version of SRK's Devdas: Shahid
378.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has said his character in 'Kabir Singh' was a "modern aggressive version" of Shah Rukh Khan's character in the 2002 film 'Devdas'. "It is a man who destroys himself out of love for someone...The only difference is that man is reactive, aggressive," he added. 'Kabir Singh' was a remake of the 2017 Telugu film 'Arjun Reddy'.

379.title: SRK's son AbRam prays for KKR with fingers crossed during IPL match, pic viral
379.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's eight-year-old son AbRam was spotted praying for KKR at the stadium during their IPL 2022 match against PBKS. Shah Rukh's daughter Suhana took to her Instagram Stories to share a picture of AbRam, writing, "Think it worked." KKR defeated PBKS by six wickets, chasing down a 138-run target in 14.3 overs.

380.title: Law enforcement agencies get email threatening to kill PM, execute 20 attacks
380.article_body: Law enforcement agencies have confirmed that they had received an email threatening to kill PM Narendra Modi. "I have more than 20 RDX and I have planned 20 big attacks," the email stated. "We get such emails and letters at least once a month...But we are still not completely disregarding it and will track down the sender," an officer said.

381.title: Retreating Russians leaving mines around homes, bodies: Zelenskyy
381.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned people that retreating Russian forces are creating "a complete disaster" outside the capital Kyiv. "They're mining the whole territory. They're mining homes...equipment, even the bodies of people who were killed," he said. Zelenskyy urged residents to wait to resume their lives until they're assured the mines have been cleared and there's no danger.

382.title: Mumbai saw over 16,000 properties sale registration in March 2022: Data
382.article_body: Property sale registrations in Mumbai touched over 16,000 units in March 2022, contributing nearly ₹1,131 crore to the state's revenue, according to data by Maharashtra's Inspector General of Registration. Maximum registrations were in the price band of ₹1-5 crore and homes ranging between 500-1,000 sq ft were the most preferred category of properties registered in March 2022, the data revealed.

383.title: Bulldozers used in anti-encroachment drive in Bihar; video surfaces
383.article_body: A video has surfaced after Bihar State Housing Board used bulldozers in a drive to clear land encroachments in Patna's Rajiv Nagar. Multiple unauthorised buildings that had been constructed on the land which was marked for state police have been cleared. Earlier, Uttar Pradesh Police threatened to raze the houses of two rape accused with bulldozers if they don't surrender.

384.title: HC tells woman to pay ₹3,000/month to ex-husband in alimony case
384.article_body: Bombay High Court has directed a woman who works as a teacher to pay interim maintenance of ₹3,000/month to her divorced husband, saying that alimony can be claimed by either of the spouses. The former husband alleged that he has no income and had encouraged his wife to study while he managed the household. The plea seeks ₹15,000/month as alimony.

385.title: India reports 1,260 new COVID-19 cases, 83 deaths in last 24 hours
385.article_body: India has reported 1,260 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours. Active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 13,445. Meanwhile, the death toll due to COVID-19 in the country has risen to 5,21,264 after 83 deaths were reported in the last 24 hours. India's total vaccination number is 1,84,52,44,856.

386.title: Kalicharan Maharaj, held over remarks against Mahatma Gandhi, gets bail
386.article_body: Self-proclaimed 'Godman' Kalicharan Maharaj, who was arrested in connection with a hate speech case, was granted bail after three months by the Chhattisgarh High Court on Friday. He was arrested under sedition charges for making derogatory remarks against Mahatma Gandhi at a 'Dharam Sansad'. Kalicharan was held by Raipur Police from Madhya Pradesh's Khajuraho on December 30, 2021.

387.title: Coin toss happened twice in the 2011 World Cup final
387.article_body: The coin was tossed twice in the 2011 World Cup final, which India won against Sri Lanka 11 years ago on April 2. MS Dhoni and Kumar Sangakkara both thought they had won the toss in the first attempt. Referee Jeff Crowe said he had not heard Sangakkara's call, after which the toss was redone and won by Sri Lanka.

388.title: Gautam Adani's fortune hits $100 billion mark, surpasses Mukesh Ambani's
388.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani's net worth has hit the $100 billion mark after surging by nearly $24 billion this year. He's the world's biggest gainer this year and now the world's 10th richest person, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Adani has overtaken Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani, whose fortune stands at $99 billion, and become Asia's richest person again.

389.title: Will strengthen western borders so no one can think of attacking us: Russia
389.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin had ordered the military to strengthen the country's western borders "so that it wouldn't cross anyone's mind...to attack us", Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Friday. Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu is working on a security plan, he added. Peskov alleged that unnamed nations were strengthening their military potential near Russia's western borders.

390.title: Meta staff to no longer require COVID-19 booster shots in the US
390.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta is no longer requiring its US employees to have COVID-19 boosters to enter its offices. "We updated our requirements in early March to align with CDC guidance, and now COVID-19 boosters are no longer required for entry," a Meta spokesperson said. However, its requirement of a 1- or 2-shot series of vaccination is still in place.

391.title: BBMP uploads budget online, breaks tradition of presenting it before public
391.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) for the first time uploaded the Budget for the 2022-23 fiscal on its website barely an hour before the end of March 31 which was the last day of the financial year 2021-22. The BBMP uploaded the budget online without any prior announcement and broke the traditional practice of presenting Budget before the media.

392.title: 5.5 lakh households in Ghaziabad to get unique IDs over property tax
392.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has decided to issue an 18-digit unique identification number to about 5.5 lakh households under its jurisdiction, officials said. About 1.68 lakh properties were never charged property tax, as per a GIS-based survey conducted by the civic body. "In future, the unique number may also be used for the provision of services," an official added.

393.title: Thane man falls from train into Mumbra creek; rescue op halted due to high tide
393.article_body: A 34-year-old man fell from a train into a creek in Thane's Mumbra on Friday, according to the civic body. Police said the man, who was taking his mother to a hospital in Ghatkopar, lost his balance when the train reached the bridge above the creek. Officials had launched a rescue operation, which was later halted due to high tide.

394.title: Explosion sounds on Shah's route in B'luru cause security scare
394.article_body: Explosion sounds heard on Union Minister Amit Shah's route in Bengaluru caused a security scare on Friday. After a police investigation, it was reportedly found that the explosion was due to a short circuit in the sewage system's underground electric cables in Vasanth Nagar area. The area was completely cleared for a security inspection to be certain of the cause.

395.title: Sri Lanka declares state of emergency amid protests over economic crisis
395.article_body: Sri Lanka has declared a nationwide state of emergency after protests over the country's worst economic crisis in decades turned violent. In a gazette notification, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa said the decision was taken in the interests of public security. On Thursday, hundreds of protesters clashed with police outside Rajapaksa's house after tear gas was fired. Over 50 people were arrested.

396.title: Sachin Tendulkar had not let Virender Sehwag watch 2011 World Cup final live
396.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar hadn't let Virender Sehwag watch the 2011 World Cup final live, and neither watched it himself, despite being in the dressing room when India were chasing the 275-run target. Sachin revealed that in an earlier match, when they were getting a massage, India played well. Sachin stopped Sehwag from watching the final because of the same superstition.

397.title: NCB's witness in Aryan Khan drug case Prabhakar Sail dies due to heart attack
397.article_body: Prabhakar Sail, who was NCB's panch witness in the Mumbai cruise drug case involving Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan, passed away due to heart attack on Friday. He was an independent witness and had accused NCB officials of extortion. Sail was the bodyguard of NCB witness Kiran Gosavi, the self-styled private detective whose selfie with Aryan went viral.

398.title: MS Dhoni's 2011 World Cup final bat is the most expensive bat ever
398.article_body: The bat MS Dhoni used to hit the 2011 World Cup final-winning six holds the record for being the most expensive cricket bat in history. Dhoni's bat was bought by Mumbai-based brokerage firm RK Global for £100,000 (then ₹72 lakh) at a charity dinner in London, three months after the final. The proceedings went to Dhoni's wife's charitable organisation.

399.title: Day temperatures in Pune likely to touch 40°C in next few days: IMD
399.article_body: As per India Meteorological Department (IMD) officials, the day temperatures in Pune may increase to 40°C in the next few days. "The sky is likely to remain clear. The night temperature in the city is likely to be around 15°C," IMD Pune's scientist Anupam Kashyapi said. According to Kashyapi, heatwave conditions in Maharashtra are likely to continue.

400.title: Gang kidnaps LPG cylinder delivery staff, extorts ₹2 lakh in Pune
400.article_body: Three people were arrested after a gang of six allegedly kidnapped two LPG cylinder delivery staff by intercepting the auto while posing as crime branch officials. The gang accused the staff of selling the cylinders in black market and demanded that they pay ₹5 lakh, but later released them after extorting ₹2 lakh from the duo's families, according to police.

401.title: Will Smith resigns from Oscars Academy over Chris slap, says 'I betrayed their trust'
401.article_body: Actor Will Smith has resigned from the Oscars Academy after slapping comedian Chris Rock on stage during last Sunday's ceremony. "My actions at...94th Academy Awards presentation were shocking, painful, and inexcusable," he said. Will added, "I betrayed the trust of the Academy. I deprived other nominees and winners of their opportunity to celebrate and be celebrated for their extraordinary work."

402.title: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 10th time in 12 days
402.article_body: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 10th time in 12 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹102.61/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹93.87/litre from ₹93.07/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹117.57/litre from ₹116.72/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹101.79/litre from ₹100.94/litre.
